column1: Principal Product Development Project Management Specialist
column2: The Principal Program Analyst will closely collaborate with cross-functional project teams within MEIC and GBUs        This role involves leading medium to high complexity breakthrough software development projects, focusing on existing product improvements or implementing new features      The incumbent will be instrumental in fostering business engagements, enhancing value through process improvements, and adopting best practices                             Essential Duties and Responsibilities:                As a Principal Program Analyst at Medtronic, the individual will play a vital role in supporting the development and execution of strategic programs.            Responsibilities include:                            Leading the planning, execution, and monitoring of strategic programs to ensure alignment with organizational objectives.                          SAFe/ RTE or handling ART Experience                          Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define project scope, goals, and deliverables.                          Developing and maintaining detailed project plans, timelines, and resource allocation schedules.                          Conducting thorough analysis of program performance metrics, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights.                          Preparing and presenting regular progress reports, status updates, and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.                          Proactively identifying risks, issues, and dependencies and developing mitigation strategies.                          Serving as a subject matter expert on program management best practices.                          Fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement within the program management team.                          Principal Working Relationships:                    The Principal Program Analyst reports to the Senior program manager and partners with engineering leaders        Key liaisons include technical leads, core team members, other project managers, and GBU stakeholders      This position is responsible for leading and managing the day-to-day operations for complex projects and serves as the Single Point of Contact (SPOC)               Experience:                              Minimum of 13 years of relevant experience with at least 5 years in a project leadership role.                          Hands-on experience in Agile methodology preferred. SAFe/RTE/Scrum Master                          Project experience in enterprise software development, mobile/cloud applications, and embedded platforms preferred.                        Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:                                Familiarity with FDA Quality System Regulations, European Regulatory Requirements, and IEC-62304.                          Strong project management skills with a track record of managing projects to schedule, budget, and scope.                          Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project, Jira, Confluence).                          Experience with Agile, Waterfall, or SDLC methodologies and processes.                          Excellent interpersonal, influence management, and conflict resolution skills.                          Ability to manage teams with diverse cultural backgrounds.                          Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.                          Effective planning and organization skills, including the ability to work against multiple objectives simultaneously.                          Proficiency in Microsoft Office products.                        Education:                                Masters degree preferred.                          Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related Engineering field.                          PMP certification and Certified ScrumMaster preferred.                        Short-Term Success Metrics (6-12 months):                                Demonstrate complete project planning and work assignment planning.                          Establish project dashboard and communication channels with Engineering Managers.                          Demonstrate stakeholder engagement and successful Quarterly Business Review (QBR).                          Demonstrate understanding of the product development process.                          Establish and measure metrics to demonstrate progress.                        Long-Term Success Metrics (1+ year):                                Demonstrated strategic thinking to forecast business needs and execute flawlessly.

column2: Top knowledge and experience in IT architecture,      technology strategy, and software development.  Analytical skills and ability to abstract, as well as      deep technical understanding, to present complex relationships simply and      to develop from architecture to portfolio elements readiness for sales.  In-depth knowledge of market-relevant Cloud ecosystems      and experience with partners (e.g., Red hat, VMware, OpenStack, Microsoft      Azure, Google, Amazon Web Services, Kubernetes, etc.) as well as in the      open source environment and Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF). In-depth knowledge especially in Cloud (IaaS, PaaS,      SaaS), networking, telecommunications, virtualization, automation,      business customer solutions, and systems management. In-depth knowledge of modern software development using      Agile methodology e.g., SCRUM, Spotify, etc. Sound knowledge in the creation of cloud-based pricing      models and the creation of products/portfolio price calculations. Experience in project management and complex projects      at large companies. High social competence as well as a distinctive ability      to work in a team (also in international and virtual teams). Flexibility and willingness to travel (nationally) is      expected. Responsibilities As Senior Product/Portfolio Manager you are responsible for the development of portfolio elements and solutions in the Cloud Managed Services Area, based on various technologies. You will define viable product/portfolio elements that meet customer needs throughout the lifecycle and work closely with the development and DevOps teams. Your role will include developing program vision, and roadmaps and delivering business value through agile methodologies. Further responsibilities of your activity are: Your support as a product/portfolio manager in cooperation with Sales and Vertical Business owners to transfer the requirement of the market into product development. Independent technical leadership of the international product/portfolio development teams. Representing the portfolio to stakeholders, partners,      and internal committees.  You will work out innovative technologies and      architectures and together with the developers from delivery implement      those in an agile/devops fashion. You will accompany the implementation of new cloud      architectures in T-Systems and Telecom products and platforms and support      pre-sales activities.  You will be responsible for mapping customer      requirements to existing and future T-Systems solutions in the Big Data      and Cloud environment. You will prepare service descriptions,      product/portfolio costings, sales presentations, and product/portfolio      roadmaps and operate T-Systems' portfolio management tools. Analysis of optimization potentials and derivation of      measures. You understand complex platform architectures and      underlying technologies. Assessment of requirements from compliance, IT      security, and regulatory markets.  Creation of business cases, definition of required      funding, and budget owner for the product owners and the developers. Selection of suitable candidates in the different      locations to further strengthen the team. C-level platform architecture consulting in customer      projects. Integration of new cloud products into the managed      service portfolio in coordination with architects and delivery managers. Design and delivery of training and workshops for      external and internal customers. Market research for the cloud portfolio area which you      are responsible for Integration of new cloud products into the managed      service portfolio and customer architectures.  Contact person for customers and partners      (architecture, network, operations, software development).  In-depth knowledge of market pricing, sales channels,      and marketing campaigns for the respective cloud portfolio

column2: As a Product Manager for software development, you will be responsible for the overall success of a software product or service. You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders, customers, and the development team, overseeing the products entire lifecycle from ideation to launch and beyond. Your role will involve defining the product vision, setting priorities, and ensuring that the development team delivers a high-quality product that meets customer needs and drives business growth.           Key Responsibilities:             Product Strategy:           Define and communicate a clear product vision, strategy, and goals.         Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities and threats.         Align the product roadmap with company objectives and customer requirements.           Product Roadmap and Planning:           Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines feature development and release schedules.         Prioritize features and enhancements based on business value, user feedback, and market trends.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to execute the roadmap.           User-Centered Design:           Understand user needs and create user stories, personas, and use cases.         Work closely with UX/UI designers to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly product.         Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback to refine the product.           Development Team Collaboration:           Act as the product owner in an Agile or Scrum development environment.         Work with development teams to clarify requirements, provide guidance, and ensure on-time delivery.         Remove roadblocks and make trade-off decisions when needed.           Product Launch and Marketing:           Plan and execute product launches, including feature announcements and marketing strategies.         Collaborate with the marketing team to create product collateral and promotional materials.         Monitor product performance and gather user feedback post-launch.           Performance Analysis:           Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the products success.         Analyze data and user feedback to make data-driven decisions and drive continuous improvement.         Make adjustments to the product strategy and roadmap as needed.           Stakeholder Communication:           Communicate product updates and progress to internal stakeholders and executives.         Act as a liaison between the development team and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment on priorities and goals.           Qualifications:           Bachelors degree in a related field (eg, Computer Science, Business, or Engineering). MBA or advanced degree is a plus.         Proven experience as a Product Manager in software development with 12+yrs experience         Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc).         Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.         Analytical and data-driven mindset.         Proficiency in project management and product management tools.         Knowledge of the software development lifecycle and technologies is preferred.             A Product Manager in Software Development plays a pivotal role in shaping the success of software products and services. They must balance business objectives with customer needs and have the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software products that drive growth and customer satisfaction.
column11: Product management, Computer science, Product launch, Competitive analysis, Project management, Analytical, Software development life cycle, Market research, Continuous improvement, Usability testing

column2: Defining the product vision and strategy: You will be responsible for defining the overall vision and strategy for the product, including identifying key customer needs and market opportunities.             Conducting market research and analysis: You will be responsible for conducting market research and analysis to identify trends and opportunities in the marketplace, as well as to assess the competition and potential customer demand.             Developing product requirements: You will be responsible for developing detailed product requirements, including technical specifications, user interface design (coordinating with the UX team), and functionality.             Coordinating with cross-functional teams: You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as engineering (Technical Lead), UX design (Design lead) and software project management to ensure that the product is developed and delivered on time.             Ensuring product quality: You will be responsible for ensuring that the product meets the highest standards of quality and is free of defects.             Prioritization: You will work closely with the team and create/prioritize the backlog.             You will manage the entire product lifecycle, including product development, launch, and post-launch support.             You will define key performance indicators (KPIs) for your product and track performance against goals by using data analytics.                 Requirements:             Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.             5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in the automotive industries.             Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.             Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritize competing demands and make data-driven decisions.             Experience with Agile development methodologies.             Strong leadership skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire teams to achieve business goals.             Embedded or Linux based software development experience is preferable.             Experience in C++/Java programming is preferable

Product Strategy and Vision:          - Develop and communicate a compelling product vision and strategy aligned with the      companys overall goals and market trends.        - Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and user research to identify user needs and      market opportunities.        - Define product roadmaps and prioritize features based on customer feedback, business      objectives, and technical feasibility.                        2. column2: As a Product Manager, you will play a crucial role in defining and developing of our Products     You will be responsible for defining the product strategy, prioritizing solutions and features, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to successfully bring the product to market     The person we are looking for has a strong blend of technical, business, and interpersonal skills     At Trustrace Product Managers are closely monitoring market and industry demand and needs, and are working closely with Market research and enterprise Customers to set the vision, and prioritize Product development     The PM must have a deep understanding of the Product framework, to be able lead the work of transforming insights to solution and design     You will work closely with the Product Owner and Tech-leads, and GTM and sales           You will have the ownership to       Setting and aligning product vision and strategy with all stakeholders, including a clear, documented definition of the Product.         Understand the market fit of the Product and drive for growth of usage and revenue (by right prioritization of roadmap and other actions).         Awareness of customers and users of the Product, and how they are using it (including objective metrics).         Awareness of competitions and strength/leakiness.         Identify where Product is a fit to usage, from business value and usability point of view, and where there are GAPs (as potential inputs of roadmap).         Define, monitor metrics, and analyse data to act as input of roadmap.         Ensure the product roadmap up to date, and communicated to relevant stakeholders.         Prepare business case as input of prioritization of roadmap, and present to prioritization board, including suggestion.         Follow up on success of release (including objective metrics)       Product Manager reports to Product Managing Director, Product Owner reports to Product Manager.       About you and expected experience       To be successful:       You have a true passion for product development and realisation of value.         You appreciate working in a collaborative team spirit with common goals and success criteria. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal abilities.         Strong organisational and project management skills, proven experience of getting products out to the market.         Proven experience to collaborate and communicate with global customers and other external market actors.         Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision making.         Familiar with agile development methodologies.         You are used to work and travel in a global context with colleagues in Asia, Europe and US.         Experience within Supply chain traceability and Fashion industry is a plus       Your style:       You have a high degree of autonomy and are able work independently, and at the same time you appreciate collaborations and team work.         You are good in balancing precision and speed, and feel confident in a fast pace influenced by an experimental mindset.         You got excellent communication skills and of course fluent in English.

column2: We are seeking an experienced and talented Product Manager to join our fast-growing fintech startup. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of our product strategy. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and business development, to ensure the successful delivery of innovative financial products to our customers. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience, including at least 1 year in a product management role. A graduation from a tier 1 college is preferred.       Responsibilities:       1. Develop and execute the product strategy and roadmap, aligned with the company s overall vision and goals.   2. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and emerging opportunities.   3. Collaborate with stakeholders to define product requirements, features, and user stories that deliver exceptional value to our customers.   4. Prioritise and manage the product backlog, ensuring that resources are allocated effectively and timelines are met.   5. Work closely with engineering teams to translate product requirements into clear specifications and user stories, ensuring timely and high-quality product delivery. 6. Collaborate with design teams to create intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and experiences that drive customer engagement and satisfaction.   7. Track and analyse key product metrics, user feedback, and market data to drive continuous improvement and optimise product performance.   8. Coordinate with marketing and business development teams to develop Go-to-Market strategies, product positioning, and launch plans.   9. Act as a subject matter expert for the product, providing guidance and support to internal teams and external stakeholders.   10. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements to ensure our products remain competitive and compliant.       Qualifications:       1. Bachelor s or Management degree from a tier 1 college.   2. Minimum of 3 years of professional experience, with at least 1 year in a product management role, preferably in the fintech industry.   3. Strong understanding of finance, banking, or related domains, with a keen interest in financial technology and innovation.   4. Demonstrated ability to develop and execute product strategies and roadmaps, from ideation to launch.   5. Proven experience in defining product requirements, creating user stories, and working closely with engineering and design teams.   6. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to leverage data and metrics to drive product decisions and improvements.   7. Strong project management and organisational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.   8. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders

column2: Ingersoll Rands Power Tools & Lifting Business Unit develops and commercializes a broad portfolio of products for the global market.                      As Product Manager - Industrial Equipment, you will report to the Director of Product and drive new product research and development efforts focused on Industrial Lifting, Material Handling, Engine Starters, Air Motors, and other Industrial Equipment product categories.                      At the conclusion of the product development process, the Product Manager will collaborate with Commercial and Marketing teams to build customer awareness and support sales enablement.                 This hybrid role offers a mix of remote (work from home), in-office (Bengaluru, India), and in-field workdays.                      In the field, the Product Manager will conduct research with end users to gain an understanding of their needs and represent the Voice of the Customer for internal project stakeholders. In our Bengaluru, work with a world class team of Engineers to guide product design and build relationships with Commercial, Supply Chain, and Product Marketing stakeholders.                                      Key measures of success for the Product Manager will include category sales performance; new product vitality; new product quality, speed-to-market, and profitability; quality of research reporting (user, market, and competitive analysis); and ability to execute the strategic initiatives of the Business Unit leadership.                            Key Responsibilities:                       Identify and cultivate distributor & end-user relationships for product research and field testing                     Summarize and communicate Voice of Customer (VOC) feedback to project stakeholders                     Conduct market and competitive analysis to gauge commercial opportunity for new products                     Work with Sales team and Distributors in field to identify product opportunities and provide training                     Optimize product value proposition and assist in development of product marketing collateral                     Collaborate with Commercial and Brand leaders to implement and support promotional activities                     Assess performance and manage product lifecycle for current SKU portfolio                     Secure commitment from Commercial leads on new product forecasts and coordinate supply chain                     Execute in a timely manner all tactical business needs related to product, P&L maintenance                     Take on additional assignments as needed for the business and personal developmental needs                             Qualifications:                         4-year degree, preferably in Business or Engineering                     10+ year work experience in industrial product sales/marketing or product management                     Experience with customized / configured-to-order products                     Ability to travel 25-50% of the time, including multi-day overnight travel                             Core Competencies:                         Passion for developing customer-focused new product solutions                     Strong interpersonal and communication skills for working in a collaborative team environment                     Self-starter and problem-solver who can identify and resolve process constraints; own results                      Effective project management, organizational, and analytical skills                     Ability to multitask and manage several milestones simultaneously                     Proficient in MS Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, etc                     What do we offer                   5 day working week                 Equity Grant to New Hires                 Leave Encashment                 Insurances                 Many More Benefits

column2: Providing the technical support for new International products within the different International Markets and working closely with cross-functional team to discern internal and external customer product wants and needs     This support would encompass engineering issues and creating new assemblies, parts drawings      This role would require to provide fundamental engineering leadership and expertise     Conduct feasibility studies and develop engineering criteria     Performs expertise analyses to develop design options or recommendations for structures, systems and components     Emphasis will be placed on team participation and ability to achieve results on assigned projects               Specific responsibilities           Seeks and receives mentoring from senior level and engineering leadership.     Applies basic supply chain cost, value stream capabilities and economic principles.     Seeks approval of budget owner using appropriate request process.     Performs additional responsibilities as requested to achieve business objectives.     Follows engineering and quality processes.           Minimum Requirements (Key Knowledge, Skills Abilities):           4 year degree in Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent     Exposure to project management concepts may be essential for some assignments.     Must be able to assess process concepts and to determine where continuous improvement opportunities exist.     Must be able to communicate effectively with peers and develop a partnering relationship with other team members.     Experience and knowledge in the use of common office automation, communication, software and tools, Herman Miller mainframe applications and engineering related software.     Must have problem solving ability and be able to apply engineering expertise to problem solving.     With minimal supervision must be able to effectively react to changing priorities and work flow and be able to anticipate, recognize, and respond effectively to changes which affect project plans.     Must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without accommodation           Essential Functions:           Research, investigate and understand product criteria, functions, requirements and cost targets (customer criteria, performance requirements, build objectives, manufacturability, assembly, quality, craftsmanship, service, installation).         Independently develops and applies engineering approaches to projects/assignments.     Defines and completes engineering tasks with minimal oversight of leadership.     Investigate new or existing suppliers, materials and manufacturing processes that could provide solutions.     Complete sketches, models, detailed engineering analysis and studies that support the development of new parts and products;     Develop and specify appropriate prototype fabrication processes and materials; coordinate the build of prototype products and the fabrication of prototype parts.     Evaluate and test concept models and prototypes against the project objectives, criteria and requirements.     Identify potential problems on new products and concepts, and develop good corrective actions by following a rigorous problem solving process.     Solicit cost estimates for prototype and production parts.     Communicate clear, concise, accurate and detailed engineering documentation (ECOs, deviations, test requests, work orders, model shop requests, drawings, instructions, emails, etc.).     Work directly with Performance Engineering to develop Performance Requirements and test plans; request physical testing on parts and products then evaluate test results.     Create, maintain and release accurate 3D CAD models, drawings, service parts, instruction sheets, gerber files, schematics, ECOs, BOMs and material specifications for prototype products and production products.     Support the development of planning guides, CSI, tech specs, product labeling and marketing materials.     Support the completion of PPAP and assure parts are properly released for production following HMI procedures.     Work directly with Quality Engineering, Dimensional Engineers and suppliers to refine product designs to achieve quality and craftsmanship objectives.     Manage individual task work to meet project team objectives for budget and timing.     Regularly review part and product designs with development team members, managers, designers and suppliers to solicit their feedback and suggestions for improvements.     Maintain engineering notes, models, records, calculations and analysis that demonstrate the progression of the product designs and review with lead engineers.     Complete patent disclosures and Right to Use (RTU) with HMI legal staff.     Support new patent applications with HMI legal staff when appropriate.     Support other project team members and project activities that require input and task work from the product development engineer: project schedules, project budgets, CMF development, prototype builds, PRs, testing, supplier communications.           Person profile Experience Competencies       8+ years of professional level experience in new product development or continuous improvement of current products.     Demonstrated proficiency in Creo modeling or other equivalent 3D CAD software.     Ability to effectively produce clear accurate and detailed engineering drawings.     Effective communication skills at all levels     Ability to take initiative and assume accountability.     Ability to work with teams and achieving quality results on time.     Lateral thinker and confident problem solver           Characteristics     1. Thinks logically and conceptually     2. Develops innovative ideas and methods     3. Can establish priorities and handle many projects     4. Welcomes responsibility, make decisions and accepts risk.     5. Can work independently and as part of a team. 6. Has flexible approach to change.

column2: Lead Product Manager         Lead Product Manager       Our Product Managers need to be extremely agile and on top of technology. They need to think big and multi-task. They should be able to deal with ambiguity, in fact, thrive in it. The right person for this role is analytical and driven to deliver business results. It will be your responsibility to create, prioritize and maintain product backlogs according to business value and ROI and lead a product team in achieving goals set by you and the product management team. You ll also be the product owner for parts of the user experience, involving primarily the user journey, and lead continuous product discovery together that informs the roadmap for your area. This requires people skills, leadership, technical understanding, project management and really nice communication skills (verbal, written and conceptual).         KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES         Game Features (responsible for several streams - economy Balancing, promotions, new features, optimizations and to improve the KPIs)         Game Analysis (collaboration with game data analyst and leverage data to monitor games performance and recommend AB tests and solutions to optimize the mechanics, inputs for new features to improve the player engagement, retention and monetization)         Project management (Agile, JIRA)         Team collaboration and mentoring the team         Communication (regular updates to all the stakeholders)         Collaborate with game designers to develop acquisition, retention and monetization based on Market Research. WHAT DO WE OFFER         Competitive salary, discretionary annual bonus scheme and stock allowance;         Flexible timing and work from home days;         Located in the heart of vibrant Bangalore. Our office is a stones throw from everything you need;         Beautifully designed large office space;         Work directly with experienced founders with deep expertise in their fields.

column2: We have an opportunities for portfolio campaign lead for leading bank for Mumbai location, Candidates from NBFC and Fintech and Banks will be preferred . Role summary and key responsibilities: - Our liabilities business is presently one of the fastest growing in the industry both in terms of customers and size of the book, coming on the back of superior product proposition and industry leading digital capabilities - In next few years, we want to grow the liabilities book by at least 4-5x. In line with overall strategy of the bank, we will build and scale up truly transformational digital, analytics and organizational capabilities which will enable us to acquire high quality customer base and then build deep banking relationship with them to drive this growth - As part of this ambition, we want to create country's best digital-led engagement channels to service and engage our most premium customers - The operating model for this engagement channel and portfolio management would be significantly differentiated from traditional setups both in terms of people and tech capabilities. - Our intent is to go to market and differentiate our product in the market on the back of the experience and engagement delivered through this channel for our customers We are looking to hire a strong member in the liabilities portfolio strategy team who would be a key enabler in the non-linear growth of the book. You will report directly to the Head of Portfolio Strategy and Growth of Retail Liabilities (RL). You will be responsible for the Design & execution of digital campaigns for mapped customer base with 2 key responsibilities: 1. Campaign design and execution a. Responsible for executing all digital campaigns across platforms b. Collaborate with internal cross-sell, personalization and marketing teams for content & execution c. Design digital campaigns including campaign platform strategy and identification of customer base for targeting d. Plan, execute, and measure hacks, experiments and conversion tests e. Collaborate with assisted channels (e.g. field RMs, Virtual RMs) for drop off management in digital campaigns 2. Measurement and tracking performance a. Measure and report performance of all digital campaigns across platforms b. Co - own digital engagement targets for activation and engagement (e.g. funding, balance build, cross sell and servicing ) c. Co-responsible for conversion rate optimization on digital campaigns incl. funnel analytics and hacks to improve conversion Key skills and background: - Challenger mindset & passion to challenge status quo to find innovative solutions to drive out of the box ideas - Superior analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and make data-driven decisions - Believer in entrepreneurial culture of brutal ownership, transparency, and trust - Strong leadership and management skills, with a track record of building and managing high-performing teams - Hustler, with solid experience in designing and executing digital campaigns - Deep knowledge of industry trends and experience in competitor research, analysis, and industry benchmarking - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with customers, colleagues, and senior management - Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously Minimum qualification: - 5+ years of relevant work experience in running and executing digital campaigns across banking / financial services / fintechs / consumer tech companies - MBA from Tier I/II business school; minimum of a Bachelors Degree from Tier I/II institutes

column2: We are looking for a    Product Owner    who can fully understand and analyze both internal and external customer needs and then articulate those needs to the development team via user stories. A member of the Product Management team, you ll work closely with an agile team of Software and Quality Engineers, serving as the interface between our customers and the development team throughout the planning and software development process.     You will collaborate closely with internal customers (Product Management, Engineering, Support, Customer Success) and external customers to understand business processes/goals and identify business problems that may be effectively resolved with technology solutions. Working closely with Product Managers on requirements definition, documenting proposed software solutions, and maintaining a prioritized backlog of issues.      The ideal candidate should be highly collaborative with the ability to lead cross-functionally and inspire our teams while remaining focused on results and value creation. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. This role provides a great opportunity to partner with our technical teams to define, build, and deliver our software solutions to a diverse group of customers.         What will you do?          Integrate in the agile development team to drive successful product delivery and serve as the voice of the customer     Collaborate with Product Managers to formulate our product vision, strategy, and roadmap     Work closely with Product Managers creating, reviewing, refining epics, features, stories and acceptance criteria to create and maintain a product backlog of maximum value that is aligned with product strategy     Organize and refine feature requests, prioritize enhancements with Product Managers, and assist in managing the product roadmap.     Own the product backlog, balancing conflicting priorities to determine prioritization     Own the release planning and sprint planning processes, including setting release and sprint goals, and successfully delivering on those goals     Provide an active role in mitigating risks and issues impacting successful team completion of release and sprint goals     Ensuring acceptance criteria are met with current release and conducting sprint reviews from a business/customer perspective.     Producing documentation with Product Managers and Marketing to support development, launch, support, services, and sales and marketing initiatives     Performing detailed product demonstrations for external and internal audiences to communicate the benefits of the solution     Serving as a subject matter expert to assist with sales and support as needed         How will you do it?          Drive & Grit - Operate in a fast-paced environment with a focus and determination to achieve high-quality results     Strategic Thinker - determine opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future trends with the ability to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way     Product Focus - Translate market and customer feedback into requirements, driving product delivery through an agile release process     Customer Focused - passionate about creating value for our customers     Cross-functional leadership - Lead and drive execution across Development, Product Management, Support, and Customer Success         Are you a fit?          Minimum qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in a relevant field OR equivalent professional experience     Two or more (2+) years of experience in product owners

column2: As a Product Manager for software development, you will be responsible for the overall success of a software product or service     You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders, customers, and the development team, overseeing the products entire lifecycle from ideation to launch and beyond     Your role will involve defining the product vision, setting priorities, and ensuring that the development team delivers a high-quality product that meets customer needs and drives business growth                 Key Responsibilities:             Product Strategy:           Define and communicate a clear product vision, strategy, and goals.         Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities and threats.         Align the product roadmap with company objectives and customer requirements.           Product Roadmap and Planning:           Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines feature development and release schedules.         Prioritize features and enhancements based on business value, user feedback, and market trends.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to execute the roadmap.           User-Centered Design:           Understand user needs and create user stories, personas, and use cases.         Work closely with UX/UI designers to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly product.         Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback to refine the product.           Development Team Collaboration:           Act as the product owner in an Agile or Scrum development environment.         Work with development teams to clarify requirements, provide guidance, and ensure on-time delivery.         Remove roadblocks and make trade-off decisions when needed.           Product Launch and Marketing:           Plan and execute product launches, including feature announcements and marketing strategies.         Collaborate with the marketing team to create product collateral and promotional materials.         Monitor product performance and gather user feedback post-launch.           Performance Analysis:           Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the products success.         Analyze data and user feedback to make data-driven decisions and drive continuous improvement.         Make adjustments to the product strategy and roadmap as needed.           Stakeholder Communication:           Communicate product updates and progress to internal stakeholders and executives.         Act as a liaison between the development team and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment on priorities and goals.           Qualifications:           Bachelors degree in a related field (eg, Computer Science, Business, or Engineering). MBA or advanced degree is a plus.         Proven experience as a Product Manager in software development with 12+yrs experience         Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc).         Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.         Analytical and data-driven mindset.         Proficiency in project management and product management tools.         Knowledge of the software development lifecycle and technologies is preferred.

column2: We are looking for an innovative, customer centric Manager with telecom and managed services experience to establish, prioritize and lead the implementation of key functionality within our ITSM customer portal to elevate our customer s experience      The Manager will play a critical role in ensuring an exceptional user experience for our customers, providing them with seamless access to information, resources, and support      The Manager will oversee selection of release cycles for enhancements, maintenance, and optimization of the portal      This role requires a critical blend of technical expertise, project management skills, and a deep understanding of how to select and execute critical UX functionality for outstanding customer experience      The Digital Product Manager will lead the creation of engaging, user-friendly interfaces, features, and functionality for AireSpring s innovative portal, AIreCONTROL      In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, operational leaders, customer focus groups, partner focus groups, developers, and UX designers to understand user needs and translate them into intuitive and feature rich functionality      Functionality will come from various highly effective proprietary platforms as well as best in class element management systems      Leveraging the impressive content available, you will be responsible for conceptualizing and implementing designs that enhance the overall user experience and drive customer and partner satisfaction          Overall Responsibilities:        - Design and develop intuitive user interfaces, critical and informative operational data and customer experience enhancing applications for AIreCONTROL that align with customer business objectives and user needs.      - Lead the development and implementation of new features, enhancements, and functionality for AIreCONTROL. Selecting the most useful data to bring forward into AIreCONTROL from the vast amount of insightful information from Element Management platforms such as VeloCloud Orchestrator, FortiManager, and a host of other data rich platforms as well as our award-winning proprietary tools for service delivery and service assurance.      - Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, product management, engineering, and customer support to gather requirements and prioritize development efforts.      - Conduct user research, surveys, and feedback analysis to understand customer and partner needs and preferences that will improve the usability, accessibility, and engagement of AIreCONTROL.      - Implement user interface enhancements, navigation improvements, and content updates to optimize the portals effectiveness.      - Ensure the portals reliability, security, and performance through regular monitoring, testing, and maintenance activities.      - Manage software updates, patches, and integrations to keep the portal up-to-date and aligned with business objectives.      -Collaborate with product managers and UX designers to define user requirements and translate them into design concepts leveraging wireframes, prototypes, and/or mockups to communicate design ideas and gather feedback from stakeholders.      - Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in user interface design and web technologies.            Content Management Responsibilities:        - Oversee the creation, organization, and maintenance of content within AIreCONTROL, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and completeness.      - Develop content strategies to address customer needs throughout their journey, from onboarding and training to ongoing support and self-service.      - Collaborate with subject matter experts to create and update documentation, tutorials, FAQs, and other resources for users.        Stakeholder Engagement Responsibilities:        - Serve as the primary point of contact for internal stakeholders and external partners involved in the customer portal initiative.      - Communicate updates, milestones, and issues related to portal development and performance to relevant stakeholders.      - Foster strong relationships with customers to solicit feedback, gather requirements, and ensure their needs are represented in portal development efforts.            Analytics and Reporting Responsibilities:        - Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness and usage of the customer portal.      - Monitor portal analytics, user behavior, and trends to identify areas for improvement and track progress over time.      - Generate regular reports and insights to inform decision-making and demonstrate the portals impact on customer satisfaction, retention, and efficiency.              Requirements, skills and attributes:        - Customer-focused mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences, a strong eye for design and driving customer success.      - Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, derive insights, and make data-driven decisions.      -Proven experience designing user interfaces for web-based applications, preferably in a customer portal or B2B environment within the Telecom and Managed Services industry.      - Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies.      - Desired bachelor s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, or a related field,    or    equivalent experience in a similar role, managing customer-facing portals, websites, or digital platforms.      - Experience with measuring portal customer satisfaction and rapid response and adoption of feedback.      - Excellent communication and collaboration skills.      - Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      - Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and drive initiatives to completion.      - Experience with user experience (UX) design principles, usability testing, and web analytics.      - Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate effectively across teams.      - Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, derive insights, and make data-driven decisions.

column2: We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager to join our Product team in India, focusing on building products, platforms, and tools that will enable effective and quality energy data to customers in a faster, secure, and reliable manner.      This person will be responsible for creating and executing the product roadmap and leading product initiatives from conception to launch and subsequent iterations, by connecting user needs, technological capabilities, and business goals. This person should have experience building platform products with significant scale and complexity and supporting both external and internal customers.      This person will collaborate frequently with engineers, product designers, data science teams, other product managers locally & globally, and cross functional teams like Customer Success, Operations etc. to ensure the success of their product.      The ideal candidate is a self-starter, detail oriented, and an empathetic collaborator who enjoys breaking complex problems into smaller steps that drive iterative product development and who can create and execute roadmaps and can coordinate cross-department initiatives and drive them to completion.        What youll do:      Create and own the product roadmap for your charter aligning to the overall business and product strategy that helps build and scale Arcadia s cleantech products      Define, prioritize, and build product initiatives and features that improve the user experience, quality, and reliability of the data systems, tools, and applications      Champion the needs of the direct and indirect users of the products you build: Arcadia s customers and Arcadia employees      Build product experiences for multiple personas and partners, including customers, our support and operations teams, and our go-to-market teams      Write clear and detailed product requirements that can be easily understood by technical and non-technical audiences      Collaborate cross-functionally with peers in Engineering, Product Design, and Data Science to deliver products on time      Uncover insights from analytics, user research, and use cases that come from cross-functional partners in Customer Success, Operations, and other departments      Constantly monitor and update on the progress of the initiatives to all the relevant stakeholders and the leadership team      Balance long-term bets with short term improvements, optimizing for speed of learning and time to impact      What will help you succeed: Must-haves:      Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering or business management from top universities      8+ years of overall experience in software product management in SaaS or data/platform product companies and at least 6+ years of direct & hands-on PM experience      Experience building B2B or B2C software products, ideally with notable technical complexity      Experience working with globally distributed teams in multiple timezone environments      Strong expertise with internal tools and systems in a medium to large enterprise and building complex systems around automation      Demonstrated experience aligning and influencing cross-functional teams and diverse stakeholders      Proven ability to break down complex problems into incremental product solutions      Strong organizational and project management skills, and a proactive communication style      Ability to think strategically      A growth mindset and comfort with ambiguity      Passion for our mission, sustainability, and helping drive a clean-energy future      Nice-to-haves:      Hands on experience working in squad-based agile product development model handling teams with 10+ members consisting of engineers, designers, and data analysts      Experience working in a regulated vertical (ideally energy, but if not, a background in finance, telecom, healthcare would be helpful)      Experience working with and supporting enterprise customers      Experience working with senior leadership in driving strategic initiatives      Experience designing and shipping APIs to support customers or internal teams

column1: Product Manager - Platform Operations, Relability & Security.
column2: As Product Manager for Platform Operations, Relability & Security, you are responsible for driving the strategy and roadmap of the performance, availability, reliability, security and disaster recovery aspects of Uniphore s X platform. Your role entails close collaboration with cross-functional teams, in particular the Product and Engineering teams that build and operate all applications and services on the X Platform. You need to understand the key dependencies across systems and with respect to the above-mentioned nonfunctional requirements. You need to define the platform requirements, guide engineering and dev ops teams during the development lifecycle. You will partner closely with Product Managers, Platform SREs and Platform Engineering.                 Success in this role requires the ability to work across Uniphore Platform and the various product lines of Uniphore to establish and build rapport with various internal stakeholders. Candidate should have experience working with other application product management, engineering, InfoSec, professional services, sales engineering and support teams.                  Candidates should be great brand ambassadors of Uniphore in external discussions with partners and customers about Uniphore s X Platform. Ideal candidates will have professional experience building and managing state-of-the-art multi-tenant SaaS platforms with particular specialization on non-functional requirements.                 You will be able to balance business needs, delivery costs with technical constraints and love bringing new platform capabilities to the market, to the application developers, and to our customers.             ?     Responsibilities        Work with customer, partner and sales engineering team members to understand the performance, availability, reliability, disaster recovery, etc. capabilities expected from the platform and leverage this understanding to evolve Uniphore X Platform capabilities.     Work closely with Info Sec team to understand the security considerations expected by the market for installing confidence in the security posture exhibited by the platform and to be in conformance with regulatory and compliance needs.     Work closely with Finance to understand the cost consideration and optimization required to have good operating margins for applications deployed on X Platform     Work closely with Product Management and Engineering leadership to prioritize and schedule integration work into the Uniphore roadmap and release plan.     Work with Uniphore Engineering & QA to ensure that X Platform is load and stress tested on a continuing basis in conformance to the acceptance criteria described by you.     Work with Uniphore Delivery & Support to identify issues or key problems from performance, availability, reliability, disaster recovery, etc. capabilities of X Platform.     Work collaboratively with the GTM and operational teams on the product roadmap, timings, and key product milestones     Report to Product Management leadership & operations on progress against ongoing roadmaps for X Platform non-functional capabilities.     Respond to queries from the wider business about Platform s performance, availability, reliability, disaster recovery, etc. capabilities.         Required Skills / Experience        Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science/IT Engineering or related fields      6+ years of experience in delivering SaaS based / web-based products with 4+ years of Product Management experience. Experience working with SaaS SRE teams is a plus.     Excellent technical skill with respect to non-functional aspects of cloud software development.     Experience in working in Agile methodologies and maintaining successful working relationships with engineering     Proven analytical thinking, big picture & business thinking, leadership, problem solving, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills      Be comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to think big while paying careful attention to detail     Excellent written & oral communication

column2: As the Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for the ongoing development and maintenance of Fictiv s Manufacturing Quoting & Fulfillment platform that interfaces with customers, operations teams, and a growing global manufacturing partner network. You will own the strategy, roadmap, and implementation of solutions related to your areas of responsibility without compromising customer satisfaction, growth, reliable delivery, and operational efficiency. The solutions you will contribute to are the primary strategic vehicle for providing differentiated value to our customers and manufacturing partners to deliver best-in-class manufacturing service offerings.In this role, you will serve as the domain expert in understanding the needs of our customers and manufacturing partners, bridging the potential of technology, operational process needs, and business goals into innovative solutions that will set new standards for speed and quality of quoting and fulfilment.          What You ll Be Doing         Business acumen and domain awareness             You will research and evaluate the needs of our customers to understand their priorities and their new product development challenges, as well as hear and assess their feedback on their Fictiv experience.         You will assess the needs of internal users, understand the relevant operational workflows, and be able to identify opportunities to meaningfully increase operational efficiency.         You will assess the needs of our growing network of manufacturing partners, understand their business goals, and capabilities, and be able to identify opportunities to deliver differentiated value.         Develop a strategic vision for how to deliver on critical business goals and support Fictiv s growth trajectory. Build and execute a product roadmap that will evolve the solution to realize this vision.             Roadmap work analysis, breakdown, and scoping                   Analyze, comprehend, and take ownership of the product roadmap related to your area of responsibility and translate high-level goals into detailed objectives and projects.         Develop a robust framework for tracking input and output metrics, providing a quantitative assessment of the success and impact of each project.         Build the business case for expanding capabilities and secure alignment on investments among the management team and stakeholders.         Scope and define the requirements for each roadmap item to ensure clarity and alignment with overall product objectives.         Navigate and manage trade-offs between speed of delivery and maintaining project scope for overall project success.         Estimate project scope and timeline in collaboration with the engineering development team.         Proactively identify potential risks associated with scope decisions and work collaboratively with teams to develop mitigation strategies that align with project timelines and business objectives.         Establish a point of view of the problems to solve and bring those insights to the team.             Cross-functional collaboration             Build and maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholders to understand their unique challenges and create a foundation for successful collaboration.         Engage with teams to ensure a comprehensive understanding of the product roadmap, actively seeking input and insights.         Foster a collaborative environment where input from various departments is encouraged, promoting a holistic approach to scoping and defining product requirements.         Work with cross-functional stakeholders across software engineering, user experience design, operations, and sales and marketing to develop hypotheses and high-impact solutions.         Lead cross-functional meetings to facilitate communication between teams, establish mutual understanding, build consensus on scope, align priorities, and break down work to deliver on goals.         Actively seek feedback from stakeholders on project deliverables and adjust plans accordingly, fostering a responsive and collaborative approach to project management.             Execution and risk management             Implement Agile methodologies to organize and manage upcoming sprints, ensuring a streamlined and efficient development process.         Analyze metrics to measure success, adapting the product as needed to optimize for business outcomes and strategic priorities.         Continuously refine and increase the fidelity of project timelines as the project progresses, leveraging collaboration with the development team to address issues that may impact the estimated timelines.         Keep stakeholders apprised of project progress, providing regular updates on milestones achieved and potential deviations from the plan.         Partner with development teams in India and the US to achieve successful outcomes through communication of business needs, requirements, and priorities while removing friction where needed.         Drive product launches by ensuring that all parts of the organization are prepared at launch.          Create trust and transparency by communicating team progress and results to stakeholders; help the organization celebrate successes and learn from failures.         Travel 20% annually for team meetings, research, and training.         Maintain a daily time overlap with the US hours to communicate with teams, stakeholders, and users.         Desired Traits             Past Experience               Proven track record of product lifecycle management with 5 years of experience as a product manager, preferably focused on B2B software applications.         Experience navigating systems with interdependencies and integrations, showcasing an ability to strategically manage complex technical landscapes.         Experience developing and gaining agreement on business plans or roadmaps.         History of orchestrating complex end-to-end processes involving multiple roles, emphasizing a comprehensive understanding of cross-functional collaboration and workflow optimization.         Experience in business analysis, showcasing proficiency in optimizing internal workflows and business metrics to enhance overall efficiency and performance.         Experience in Agile methodologies and the ability to apply them to optimize development processes.         Practical experience in leveraging customer insights and metrics to drive and strategic product decisions and nurture growth.         Understanding of the business model as a manufacturing service provider.                  Desired               Experience in manufacturing, supply chains, or industries where intricate processes and logistical considerations are important to product development and delivery.         Some operating or technical knowledge in one or more manufacturing processes (3D Printing, CNC, Injection Molding, Sheet Metal, etc).

Provide expertise and support to team members on Jira best practices and workflows.      Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in Agile development, project management, and Jira functionality.      Participate in team meetings, sprint planning, and other agile ceremonies to ensure efficient collaboration and execution.            Education, Experience, and Requirements                  Required Skills/Abilities:        Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.      Proven experience as a Software product Owner      Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques and documentation.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities.      Familiarity with software development methodologies (eg, Agile, Scrum).      Knowledge of software tools and platforms used in print media is a plus.

column2: The Role:    We're on the lookout for an Assistant Product Manager to enhance our product team of Digital Construction Innovators. This role is a unique opportunity to shape the future of digital construction applications by working closely with our Engineers/Architects and directly under the guidance of the Product Owner. You'll be pivotal in analysing requirements, orchestrating feature development, and ensuring our solutions resonate with the needs of the construction industry. Responsibilities  ??   Evaluate and analyse business/site processes to identify improvement areas and generate comprehensive requirement backlogs. Conduct detailed requirements and gap analysis to understand and document user needs. Facilitate discussions and presentations to disseminate findings and brainstorm new ideas. Seamlessly integrate feature requests into the product roadmap, ensuring alignment with our strategic vision. Effectively groom and prioritise the product backlog to guide the development team's efforts. Craft acceptance tests for new features, ensuring they meet our rigorous standards. Coordinate the planning of product releases and upgrades, maintaining our commitment to innovation. Monitor project progress, proactively addressing any application-related issues to maintain momentum.    Employ feedback and insights to refine our Agile methodologies, enhancing team efficiency   Stay abreast of industry trends to ensure VisiLean remains at the forefront of digital construction technology. Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and management, providing clear insights and plans. Lead project management efforts, from planning to performance monitoring, to ensure successful delivery.     Requirements    Bachelors or Masters degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or a related field. Demonstrated analytical prowess and the ability to translate complex construction concepts for diverse audiences. Proven experience in team collaboration and fostering a positive work environment. Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written. A solid foundation in project planning and scheduling. In-depth knowledge of Lean Construction and BIM methodologies. Proficiency in creating detailed reports and delivering impactful presentations. Exceptional organisational and time management skills.

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Associate Product Manager to join our team      The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, along with experience in assessing inputs from stakeholders and defining requirement specifications      The Associate Product Manager will be responsible for analysing documents, data, user stats, and workflows to drive product development and make data-driven decisions      Additionally, the candidate should have experience in Agile Project Management, Quality Assurance, and Change Management          Key Responsibilities:          Assist the product lead to define product roadmaps and prioritize features based on market needs, customer feedback, and business objectives.      Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and user research to identify customer pain points and opportunities for product improvement.      Gather and document detailed requirements, develop user stories, wireframes, and charts to effectively communicate product requirements and features.      Work closely with engineering teams to ensure successful and timely delivery of product features, providing clarifications and support throughout the development lifecycle.      Utilize Agile Project Management methodologies to plan, execute, and track product development initiatives.      Assist in defining and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of product initiatives.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and customer success, to gather feedback, address product-related issues, and drive user adoption.      Leverage data analytics to extract actionable insights and generate MIS reports to drive product improvements.      Apply problem-solving techniques and root cause analysis (RCA) to address issues and optimize product performance.      Ensure product quality through effective quality assurance processes and testing.      Stay updated on industry trends, regulatory changes, and technological advancements in the fintech domain to contribute valuable insights to the product roadmap.          Preferred Experience:          Prior experience of fintech/supply chain finance is a plus but not mandatory.      Preference for experience with the following tools: Miro, Figma, Sketch, Jira, WebEngage, CleverTap, Notion, Trello, Whimsical      Experience in customer research and user experience design          Qualifications:          Minimum of 1.5 years of experience in a product management or related role, preferably within a startup or fast-paced environment.      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather and interpret data to drive informed product decisions.      Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.      Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines.      A self-starter who demonstrates initiative and takes ownership of assigned responsibilities.      Familiarity with agile methodologies, product development lifecycle, and project management tools.      Prior experience or knowledge of the fintech industry is a plus but not required.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Technical Product Manager to join our dynamic retail team      As a Technical Product Manager in the retail domain, you will play a pivotal role in translating business needs and market trends into innovative technical solutions      Your expertise will bridge the gap between business stakeholders and development teams, ensuring the successful delivery of products that meet customer demands and drive business growth                  Key Responsibilities:        1.    Product Strategy and Vision:          Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and refine the product vision, goals, and roadmap in alignment with the overall retail business strategy.      Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and gather customer feedback to identify market trends and opportunities.        2.    Requirement Gathering and Analysis:          Work closely with business stakeholders to elicit, document, and prioritize detailed product requirements and features.      Translate business requirements into technical specifications that development teams can execute on.        3.    Roadmap Development:          Develop and communicate a comprehensive product roadmap that outlines the timeline for feature development, enhancements, and releases.      Ensure alignment of the roadmap with business objectives and technical feasibility.        4.    Cross-Functional Collaboration:          Act as a bridge between business stakeholders, design teams, development teams, and QA teams to ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the product development lifecycle.      Facilitate discussions and decision-making to resolve conflicts and ensure progress.        5.    Project Management:          Drive the execution of the product roadmap by managing the product development lifecycle, tracking progress, and adjusting priorities as needed.      Monitor and report on project status, risks, and timelines to relevant stakeholders.        6.    Technical Expertise:          Possess a deep understanding of technical concepts and the retail domain to effectively communicate requirements and solutions to development teams.      Evaluate and recommend technical solutions that align with business goals and customer needs.        7.    Feature Delivery:          Define clear user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional requirements for development teams.      Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure timely and successful feature delivery, addressing any technical challenges that arise.        8.    Product Testing and Quality Assurance:          Work with QA teams to ensure thorough testing of features and products, validating that they meet the defined requirements and quality standards.        9.    Performance Monitoring and Optimization:          Monitor the performance of released features and products, gathering insights and feedback for continuous improvement.      Identify opportunities for optimization and enhancement based on user behavior and feedback.          Qualifications:              Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field; Masters degree preferred.      Proven experience 10+ Yrs as a Technical Product Manager in the retail industry.      Strong understanding of retail operations, customer behaviors, and market trends.      Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.      Proficiency in translating business requirements into technical specifications.      Project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.      Experience with Agile development methodologies.      Analytical mindset with the ability to use data to drive decisions.      Familiarity with software development and technologies commonly used in retail applications.      Prior experience with Point of Sale (POS) systems, inventory management, e-commerce, or related retail technologies is a plus.
