column2: Summary: B.A. Fabricators & Engineers (P) Ltd. is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Production Manager to play a key role in propelling our company to the next level. As our Production Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our daily operations, with a focus on metal fabrication and machining excellence. You will be a strategic partner to the CEO, ensuring smooth execution of company strategies and fostering a culture of high performance within our team. Responsibilities: Metal Fabrication & Machining Operations: Develop and implement efficient systems and processes to optimize workflows and streamline metal fabrication and machining operations. Identify and eliminate bottlenecks in production to maximize efficiency and on-time project delivery. Oversee work order planning and scheduling, ensuring projects are completed within budget and timeline constraints. Collaborate with the engineering team to ensure clear project specifications and effective communication throughout the production process. Team Leadership & People Management: Provide effective leadership and mentorship to the fabrication and machining team, fostering a collaborative and high-performing environment. Delegate tasks effectively, empower team members, and hold them accountable for their results. Develop and implement performance management systems to track and measure individual and team goals specific to metal fabrication and machining. Conduct exit interviews to gather feedback and continuously improve employee experience within the production team. Client Management & Business Development: Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients in the metal fabrication and machining industry, ensuring their satisfaction and exceeding expectations. Contribute to client acquisition and project proposals, leveraging your technical expertise in metal fabrication and machining to identify and address client needs. Oversee account management for fabrication and machining projects, ensuring timely delivery within budget. Financial Management: Partner with the finance department to maintain accurate financial records and reports specific to metal fabrication and machining operations. Monitor operational costs associated with fabrication and machining processes, identifying opportunities for cost savings and resource optimization. Work collaboratively with the CEO to develop and implement financial budgets and forecasts for the fabrication and machining departments. Strategic Planning & Execution: Participate in strategic planning discussions and provide valuable insights based on your expertise in metal fabrication and machining operations. Translate company vision and goals into actionable plans specific to optimizing metal fabrication and machining processes. Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and key result areas (KRAs) to track progress and measure the success of fabrication and machining operations. Continuously monitor and evaluate operational performance, identifying areas for improvement and adaptation within the metal fabrication and machining departments. Qualifications: BE (Mechanical) degree + MBA or equivalent experience with a strong focus on metal fabrication and machining processes. Minimum 7 years of experience in leading and managing metal fabrication and machining operations. Proven track record of successfully improving efficiency and productivity within fabrication and machining environments. Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate, coach, and develop a high-performing team in a manufacturing setting. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills. Experience in client handling, project management, and business development in the metal fabrication and machining industry (a plus). Proficiency in using project management tools and relevant manufacturing software applications. Ability to thrive in an informal/unstructured environment with the capacity to build structure and systems specific to metal fabrication and machining operations. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on continuous improvement in fabrication and machining processes. Demonstrated ability to set goals, track progress, and meet deadlines within the metal fabrication and machining industry. Strong work ethic with a commitment to quality, efficiency, and continuous learning in metal fabrication and machining. Additional Information: We offer a competitive compensation package and a dynamic work environment within the metal fabrication and machining industry. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for metal fabrication and machining excellence.

column2: Job Description Summary Develops specific marketing plans and activities for specific product(s) or product line(s) to establish, enhance or distinguish product placement within the competitive arena. Develops business plans and product positioning in the marketplace. Oversees market research, monitors competitive activity and identifies customer needs. Establishes pricing strategies. Works with engineering, manufacturing and sales to develop new products or enhance existing product(s) or product line.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Role holder is responsible for managing the execution of projects within the assigned program portfolio. It requires close coordination with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, while ensuring adherence to budget, timelines, and quality standards. Timely product launch using Open Innovation. Navigate OI tollgates ensuring market readiness achieved. Strong technical acumen on key technologies. Partner/Supplier/Alliance selection, evaluation, onboarding. KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND PERFORMANCE INDICATORS: Cross-functional collaboration driving team competence development and project success. Influence team for seamless product launches and business unit growth. OI product launches on time and on spec. Performance of launched OI products on revenue and profitability. WITHIN YOUR TEAM  You will join the New Product Development and Planning Team. This team is responsible for shaping future product direction, executing product plan and managing sales growth and P&L for product lines. Reporting to the OI Head in the team, you'll work and collaborate closely with associates across departments to ensure seamless delivery. KEY COMPETENCIES Motivated and Driven:  Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Your proactive approach and resilience will be key drivers of your success in this role. Team Player:  Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Your ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively will be essential for success in a dynamic team environment. Interpersonal and Communication Skills:  The ability to establish strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams is crucial. Excellent communication and interviewing skills to accurately grasp customer needs, foster collaboration, and effectively convey product vision and strategic insights to senior leadership. Effective Project Management:  Proficient in project management methodologies and techniques, with the ability to plan, execute, and monitor projects within the assigned program portfolio. Demonstrated experience in navigating complex project environments and overcoming obstacles to ensure successful project delivery. Attention to Detail:  Possess a keen eye for detail and a meticulous approach to project execution, ensuring that all aspects of the project are thoroughly reviewed and addressed. Ability to identify potential risks and issues early on and implement proactive measures to mitigate them, thereby ensuring high-quality project outcomes. WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS: Proven Experience in Program Management:  The ideal candidate should possess a strong track record of success in program management for new product development (NPD), particularly in the context of open innovation initiatives. Experience in overseeing the execution of multiple projects within a program portfolio, from initiation to delivery, is highly desirable. Leadership Skills:  Demonstrated ability to provide direction and to the cross-functional teams, driving alignment with organizational goals and objectives. The candidate should have the capability to translate business strategies into actionable project plans, ensuring the successful execution and delivery of projects. Effective Stakeholder Engagement:  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, enabling the candidate to engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels, including senior management, cross-functional teams, partners, suppliers, and alliances. The candidate should have the ability to influence and negotiate to ensure project success and foster collaborative relationships. Integrity and Professionalism:  Uphold the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating a commitment to ethical conduct and sound business practices. YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE: Bachelors degree in Engineering and MBA: The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's degree in Engineering coupled with an MBA from an institution. This educational background equips the candidate with a solid foundation in both technical and business disciplines, essential for effective program management and decision-making in product development initiatives. 12-14 years of experience in Program Management: Candidates should have an experience in program management roles, particularly in the context of new product development (NPD) and open innovation initiatives. Proven Track Record in Driving Project Success: The candidate should demonstrate a successful track record of driving project success, including on-time delivery, within budget, and meeting quality standards. Experience in managing cross-functional teams and navigating project environments is essential.

column1: Principal Product Manager (high-speed connector & signal integrity)
column2: Job Overview:- The Data and Devices Business Unit is looking for a high-speed connector & Signal Integrity Product Development Engineer to design and develop high speed I/O (Input/Output) solutions to solve Data and Devices customer needs, along with company product roadmap, manufacturing, mechanical assembly techniques, and technology roadmaps. The Product Development Engineer is responsible for the design and documentation of new products, from market definition through production and release. The position conceives original ideas for new products/solutions and develops them into practical and economical models. His/her major activities are in the areas of design, development, testing, and manufacture of connectors, products, and systems  Role & responsibilities:   Technical owner of assigned product development and product line. Fundamental understanding of connector design and mechanical assembly and/or manufacturing techniques. Expertise in certain areas of Connector development and/or Connector manufacturing. Design for Manufacturing (DFM) review, preparation, and presentation to address customer design, engineering, and manufacturing requirements. Detailed understanding of manufacturing processes to include stamping, molding, plating, and automated product assembly. Experience in development engineering and participation in full product development cycle. Demonstrated proficiency in 3D Design Applications, ProE or Spaceclaim preferred, ANSYS simulation beneficial. Strong interpersonal communication and teaming skills. English language is a must for working with a global team or customers in both written and oral communication. SI (Signal Integrity) related design experience in high-speed signal transmission is a must. Thermal management experience in high-speed signal transmission is strong plus. Familiarity of switch, server equipment is preferred  Preferred candidate profile:   BS degree in Engineering required (Mechanical / Systems discipline preferred). At least 15 years of relevant engineering experience in the connector or high-speed cable assembly industry. Excellent knowledge of high-speed .signal transmission

column2: Role & responsibilities   Person will be working as a Product Manager in LV & MV Portfolio in MOSD- Business  Product Lifecycle and road map responsible for the      engineering , implementation & change Management  Market analysis & overall features of product reviews interface b/w local & Global Factory Drives Exp is mandatory -  VFDs AC Drive/DC Drive, PCB Development etc Preferred candidate profile     Main Accountabilities: Market situation analysis    Leads market intelligence   analysis.  Understands and defines current   market segmentation and related offering positioning including relevant   regulations and standards e.g. on HSE or cyber security (both external and   ABB internal).  Identifies potential gaps in   portfolio, both against competition and new market opportunity   Existing products    Owns the technical and market   specification for the offering and determines a offering business plan that   supports sustainable growth.  Leads life cycle management   process, analyses current offering, defines and tracks performance metrics,   plans appropriate measures (e.g. enhancements, cost reductions, phase-outs)   and makes decisions on offering obsolescence and end-of life to ensure   current and future market requirements are met and maximize profitability.   Internal/external interface    Acts as interface between   external market and internal functions (e.g. Sales, Operations, and Research   & Development), forecasting volume trends on a regular basis to ensure   Operations capability to fulfil customer orders.  Sets targets and monitors   offering costs, giving inputs to Operations functions (e.g. Supply Chain   Management, Engineering, Production) to maximize competitiveness and   profitability.   New product development    Contributes to development of new   portfolios by leading customer need and value analysis, planning the roadmap   to create maximum value, follow-up of offering portfolio performance.   Product market communications    Initiates and drives product   market communication strategy, including product launch planning and   implementation.  Manages different channel to   market scenarios in coordination with channel partners and Marketing &   Sales to ensure best market coverage.   Product values    Defines product customer value   proposition per segment and channel and ensures clear communication to   channels and users, to deliver clear offering positioning within the   portfolio with defined values per offering line.   Offering to market & pricing   management    Responsible for offering   profitability and margin.  Drives the annual business   planning process and facilitates agreement between sales demand and supply.  Monitors global sales target   fulfilment and tender volumes and takes action as appropriate.  In preparation for new product   launch, and otherwise as required, defines pricing strategies and manages   global frame agreements and/or large scale cross border projects to ensure   one ABB approach.   Process development and training    Continuously develops product   management processes and tools, including interfaces to other key functions   and develops sales and tendering tools to support the Sales organization.  Initiates creation of external   and internal product training modules and programs.   Sustainability    Creates a Sustainability strategy   for the global Offering portfolio, supporting ABB's commitment to circular   economy.   Local scope - Product lifecycle,   Profitability, Product monitoring, Analysis, Sales support, R&D,   Marketing plan, People leadership and development    Manages new offering launch and   life cycle from phase-in to phase-out. Coordinates and supervises the product   road map.  Defines and oversees recovery   plans as necessary.  Responsible for the profitability   and life cycle of offering by defining pricing guidelines and market   position. column2: You will be responsible for developing and executing strategic marketing campaigns across various channels to attract and engage users, optimize conversion rates, and maximize ROI. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to align campaign objectives with product goals and leverage data-driven insights to drive continuous improvement.             Responsibilities:           Strategy Development:    Collaborate with key stakeholders to define and execute the growth strategy aligned with the companys objectives, identifying opportunities to drive user acquisition, activation, retention, and revenue growth.       Product Optimization:    Continuously analyze user data and feedback to identify areas for improvement within the product funnel. Propose and implement product enhancements and optimizations to drive key growth metrics.       Campaign Strategy:    Develop and execute comprehensive campaign strategies aligned with business objectives to drive user acquisition, activation, and retention. Define target audiences, messaging, creative assets, and channel mix for each campaign.       Performance Marketing:    Plan, launch, and optimize performance marketing campaigns across digital channels including paid search, display advertising, social media, email marketing, affiliate marketing, and other relevant channels. Monitor campaign performance, adjust bids, budgets, and targeting parameters to achieve desired outcomes.       Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO):    Collaborate with product and design teams to optimize landing pages, user flows, and conversion funnels to improve conversion rates and drive higher user engagement and retention.       Budget Management:    Manage campaign budgets effectively to achieve maximum ROI. Monitor spending against budget and make recommendations for reallocation or scaling based on performance insights.       Cross-Functional Collaboration:    Work closely with product, engineering, design, data analytics, and marketing teams to align campaign objectives with product roadmap and ensure cohesive messaging and user experience across all touchpoints.       Reporting and Analysis   : Generate regular reports and dashboards to track campaign performance, provide insights, and make data-driven recommendations for optimization. Communicate results and key findings to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.       Experimentation and Testing   : Design and conduct A/B tests, multivariate tests, and other experiments to validate hypotheses and optimize conversion rates across various user touchpoints.       User retention and insights:    Utilize quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain deep insights into user behavior, preferences, and needs. Translate insights into actionable product recommendations and features. Drive initiatives to enhance user engagement and retention, including personalized user experiences, lifecycle marketing campaigns, and customer support enhancements.       Cross-Functional Collaboration:    Work closely with cross-functional teams including product, engineering, design, marketing, and data analytics to prioritize and execute growth initiatives effectively.       Performance Tracking and Reporting   : Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish regular reporting mechanisms to monitor the effectiveness of growth initiatives. Use data-driven insights to iterate and optimize strategies over time.       Market Research   : Stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the fintech space. Leverage market research to identify opportunities for innovation and differentiation.         What youll bring?         Bachelors degree and MBA     4 to 5 years of experience in growth marketing, performance marketing, or campaign management within fintech.     Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads, etc.     Experience with A/B testing, conversion rate optimization (CRO), and other optimization techniques to improve campaign performance.     Deep understanding of digital marketing channels and best practices, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and affiliate marketing.     Proven track record of managing successful marketing campaigns that drive user acquisition, engagement, and revenue growth.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.         What Youll get?         You will build the cross-functional skills to one day become a Start-up Founder, building your own company.     You will build an in-house marketing automation platform - trained by Tech founders and data scientists who have this expertise.     You will build a deep end to end understanding of building a customer focused financial product from scratch.
column11: Loans, CRO, Email marketing, Social media, Financial planning, Market research, Customer support, SEO, Digital marketing, Testing

column2: As a Product Manager at Naehas, you will join our fast-paced Product team responsible for the definition of our marketing automation software, for our global customers and internal business stakeholders      Our Product Managers interact regularly with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, User Experience Design, Customer Success, and Finance      You will work on and execute a product strategy based on your experience and both internal and external inputs      You will be held accountable for meeting the companys broader set of goals and your product OKRs      You must possess an effective blend of interpersonal skills, business acumen, and technical savviness      You will work with cross-functional teams including business users, sales, customer success, developers, designers, QA, Ops, and other product managers      You must be able to put yourself in the shoes of the user and advocate for their needs      Success is based on features or product releases that delight the end-user and generate substantial value for the customer business            Job Responsibilities:          As a Product Manager at Naehas, you will join our fast-paced Product team responsible for the definition of our marketing automation software, for our global customers and internal business stakeholders      Our Product Managers interact regularly with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, User Experience Design, Customer Success, and Finance      You will work on and execute a product strategy based on your experience and both internal and external inputs      You will be held accountable for meeting the company's broader set of goals and your product OKRs      You must possess an effective blend of interpersonal skills, business acumen, and technical savviness      You will work with cross-functional teams including business users, sales, customer success, developers, designers, QA, Ops, and other product managers      You must be able to put yourself in the shoes of the user and advocate for their needs      Success is based on features or product releases that delight the end-user and generate substantial value for the customer business            Job Responsibilities:      - Manage the entire feature life cycle from market analysis through strategy development, requirements gathering, development, successful adoption by users, and go-to-market.    - Work with RD organizations driving product requirements and ensuring timely release of products and solutions, managing the complete life cycle of products/services.    - Manage the overall cross-product backlog for specific product areas, drive alignment across teams, and communicate status and progress.    - Gather requirements by working closely with internal and external users.    - Understand market trends and key competitors    - Clearly state the business need that the feature will address and the value that it will deliver.    - Clearly identifying key user roles and how their needs may differ.    - Vetting the requirements with the rest of the Product team and client teams so that we develop general-purpose features, not the ones that only meet the needs of one client.    - Use case articulation    - Deep understanding and clear articulation of current user workflows (as-is).    - Clear articulation of planned functionality and how it will be used (to-be).    - Make sure that the to-be workflow is well thought out and simulated as early as possible in order to identify feature design gaps.    - Be responsible for finding the right solution that meets user needs, fits well with the overall direction of the product and optimizes the value to users and to Naehas.    - Take requirements to a technical design by working with the engineering team    - Articulate the overall solution and review it with your scrum team.    - Log high-level issues in support of that design but allow development team members to flesh out the technical details when appropriate.    - Propose low-fidelity and high-fidelity mockups working with a UX designer    - Work with the QA member of your scrum team to ensure the quality of features before sprint-end as well as a plan for immediate test automation.    - Create deployment and detailed adoption plans with each client team.      Skills:      - Personal integrity    - Constant focus on user experience    - Curiosity to dig several layers deep into solutions with an eye toward continuous improvement    - Technological acumen    - Active listening    - Attention to details with the big picture in mind - Problem-solving in ambiguous environments    - Communication, both written verbal    - Proactiveness and autonomy Our Ideal Candidate will have the following experience:    - You have a solid understanding of the enterprise software market    - You are comfortable being hands-on in a fast-moving and rapidly changing environment    - You are able to articulate the value proposition/story at varying depth depending upon the audience    - You possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, and a big picture vision    - You are proficient with product management and agile processes    - You are quick learner, self-starter, and good communicator    - You have radical thinking paired with strong execution; can envision a different world and can articulate a clear path to get there      Required Qualifications, Skills, Experience:      - 3-6 years as a Product Manager for a B2B enterprise software company - Demonstrated capacity to learn as well as ability to operate independently, to effectively drive execution to achieve goals without direct authority    - Demonstrated ability to set clear and deliverable goals, balance multiple projects at once and adhere to deadlines    - Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to influence others.    - Experience and familiarity with Cloud services    - Hands-on experience with deploying enterprise-level software is a plus    - Experience in customer service or marketing is a plus    - Computer Science or other BSc degree is a plus    - Experience in marketing automation is a plus      People and culture are our top priority.      We believe the best way to describe our culture is through our values:      - Reality - Acknowledge it early    - Ownership - Be self-aware and personally accountable    - Courage - Put in best effort even under trying circumstances    - Trust - Respect team members - prove each other right    - Curiosity - Intense desire to explore and understand new solutions    - Flexibility - Flexibility and innovation are more important than efficiency    - Integrity - Our reputation is more important than making money If these values resonate with you then we look forward to meeting you.        Required Qualifications, Skills, Experience:    3-6 years as a Product Manager for a B2B enterprise software company Demonstrated capacity to learn as well as ability to operate independently, to effectively drive execution to achieve goals without direct authority Demonstrated ability to set clear and deliverable goals, balance multiple projects at once and adhere to deadlines    Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to influence others.    Experience and familiarity with Cloud services    Hands-on experience with deploying enterprise-level software is a plus    Experience in customer service or marketing is a plus    Computer Science or other BSc degree is a plus    Experience in marketing automation is a plus    People and culture are our top priority. Here s what we have to offer you as a team member at Naehas:    Competitive compensation    A full suite of benefits, including health, vision, dental, and retirement    A casual workplace that appreciates and respects each employees ideas    The agility of a growing and profitable start-up environment    Flexible work arrangements

column2: Morningstar seeks Operations Analyst to join our operations. This role will play a key role in our mission to provide exceptional client by ensuring our production processes for the Morningstar Publishing System. The Morningstar Publishing System allows clients, internal and external to create customised financial reports using both Morningstar data and data from other sources specific to their needs. This position is based in our Mumbai office.         ?       Responsibilities         Be part of the team that own and execute on the production processes for global clients on the Morningstar Publishing System and some of the other internal applications. Develop a thorough ownership and understanding of the product, process and the clients one serves.     Assure the quality of the incoming and outgoing data to the Morningstar Publishing System. Work with external and internal project stakeholders to ensure the content of the produced publications match the expected requirements.     Work on preparing various reports on Morningstar Direct.     Work close to the data teams globally to coordinate and assist with ensuring data availability for our live clients.     Identify opportunities for improving operational efficiency and reducing operational risk through the automation of operational tasks and/or improvement of existing processes.     Keep documentation of the data processes up to date, and proactively ensure that the operation risks are kept at a minimum.     Work close to the technology team to assist with new feature releases in the software product.     Although the role will be for UK shift, going ahead if required one may have to come in Regular day shift or night shift for a few days to manage other team activities.           Requirements:           Demonstrate a significant degree of experience in project and implementation management with the ability to manage multiple projects in various stages of its lifecycle.     Has in-depth knowledge of Mutual funds and a good knowledge of various other financial products available in domestic as well as in International financial markets.     Should be well versed with the basic knowledge financial terms and financial concepts.     A proven track record of managing client projects with contractual timelines and scope.     Aptitude to learn new software and technical concepts     Knowledge of Morningstar Direct basics will be a value add.     Excellent written and verbal communication and negotiation skills.     Proven ability to develop effective working relationships with both local and international stakeholders including the capabilities to develop rapport and establish trust.     Ease dealing with ambiguity; ability to create focus and keep the team on track.     Educated to degree level, an advanced degree is a plus.

column2: You will lead product management activities through the disciplined use of product sense, execution, measurements, and prioritization to build and optimize solutions for complex business issues, mainly using the ServiceNow platform     By examining business needs through a product lens, you will identify and implement new capabilities across the enterprise         Meet our team:             PayPals service management team is driving frictionless and effortless customer experiences, improving operational efficiency and customer satisfaction through a combination of process optimization and automation     Through the ServiceNow platform, we design, develop, and enhance customer experiences that better enable PayPal business functions and processes     With increasing demand, our solutions require scale across millions of daily transactions, terabytes of data, and hundreds of integrations - all while ensuring high availability to our customers             Your way to impact          You will impact the success of PayPal through the creation and launch of ServiceNow product features that meet stakeholders needs and help support PayPals IT and business operations     Your work will enable PayPal to execute digital transformation and enablement functions with other key resources     As a subject matter expert, you will use process methodologies to serve as an internal coach to help others identify product enhancements             Your day to day           Coordinate the implementation and extension of PayPal s strategic planning lifecycle leveraging ServiceNow s Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) applications.         Coordinate the migration and lifecycle of PayPal s capabilities, platforms, products, applications, and supporting services into ServiceNow Application Portfolio Management (APM) while leveraging the Common Service Data Model (CSDM) framework.         Create and maintain the backlog of ServiceNow development requests for SPM and APM using ServiceNow s Demand Management and Strategic Planning Workspace application.         Conduct application design sessions with SPM and APM stakeholders to ensure business requirements are met while protecting the platform from technical debt.         Bridge the gap among the different departments involved in successfully enabling your products, including business process owners, engineering, development, information security, and operations.                   What do you need to bring           bachelors degree OR appropriate combination of education and experience         7+ years experience in business analysis, product management, metrics and reporting, platform-based process management, or other relevant experience required         Hands-on experience enabling or operating ServiceNow SPM and APM         Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) - SPM         Experience working with ServiceNow as a planning tool and another software development tool such as Jira or Azure DevOps (ADO) for execution of development

Responsibilities:              The Product Manager is responsible for achievement of sales targets and drives continuous growth by establishing and maintaining strong marketing strategies, ensuring frontline teams are knowledgeable on the Hematology portfolio and generating compelling collateral.      The role includes generation of clinical evidence through scientific research studies, initiation and execution of customer engagement and customer education.          Specific responsibilities of the role include:            1) Achieving business results (Sales, Market Share)          Developing or contributing significantly to the overall marketing strategy of the products for Hematology business, help managing sales budgets and continually monitor actual business performance against forecast.      Developing promotional strategies and create tools, collaterals that are consistent with corporate image and objectives following MAPSS process.      Coordinating market research and gather competition data from market sources to ensure maximum capture of market intelligence. This includes getting a perspective of market size, market share and ability to create a comprehensive market map (Mekko) on the same.      Identifying new business opportunities and rightly position products and developing business case for prioritization      Analyzing and combating competitor activity by creating right tools and share with sales and applications team      Contribute in product improvement suggestions/decisions      Conducting regular VOC for insights on customer preferences, competitor analysis as well as on market developments and trend.      Developing, executing and monitoring product strategy to drive business growth in collaboration with sales mangers      Developing and managing relationships with Key Experts in conjunction with sales management;      Review and analyze sales, unit and ASP data to monitor sales achievements and identify opportunities across specific accounts and territories;      Take charge of new product launches in Hematology across the SWA region, including conducting Launch Excellence (LEx) programs to prepare frontline teams for commercial success      Develop and update long-term, quarterly and monthly product forecasts.      Recommend product pricing and design reward schemes to assist the organization to sustain profitable growth across the hematology portfolio.      Scientific marketing support: Organize CME s, Hospital Based Programs, Support scientific publications, product evaluations and organize round table discussion with key experts      Coordinate with regional marketing (APAC) to align product strategies and action plan on regular basis.      Cross-functional collaboration with teams across the organization like L&D, sales, application and service to ensure forecasting, escalating key client issues and solve the critical product issues by coordinating with regional and BU team.      Use innovative approaches to expand installed base of Hematology products by suggesting and implementing techno-commercial and/or clinical solutions.              2) Conduct Product Trainings for internal associates and external clients.          Take responsibility and accountability to educate and train the organization (incl. colleagues from sales, applications and service) on hematology concepts, applications and our hematology portfolio.      Ability to make impact on organizational learning and adding to the confidence of frontline associates on hematology is critical. This includes planning for content on knowledge retention as well.      In addition, for external stakeholders and customers, the Product Manager Hematology should proactively conduct CMEs for customers and coordinate with Applications for the same.      The accountability of this role expands to running train-the-trainer (TTT) programs in hematology for our Applications colleagues.            3)    Cultivates Strong Business Relationships          Establishes close relationships with external customers and utilizes those relationships to strengthen a competitive position and performance.      Establishes, develops and maintains ongoing relationships with customers and key experts              Person Scope:        This is a key addition to the Beckman India commercial team. You may have the opportunity to rotate into various roles across both Beckman Coulter Diagnostics and Danaher based on your performance and potential assessment.            Specifications-          Experience The person should have a minimum experience of 10 years, with 5 years of minimum experience in sales or marketing in healthcare being preferred. Experience in hematology is ideal.      Education M.Sc./B.Sc. preferably with an MBA      Good to have: Experience of handling a business size of at least $5M with a track record of business growth              Personal attributes          Go-getter Attitude, ability to energize teams to go for stretch goals      A positive mindset and problem-solving attitude is essential for this role      Ability to work in cross-functional teams. The person in this role needs excellent stakeholder management skills. Due to the multiple stakeholders, the candidate must be easy to work with      Strong willingness to work with, help, guide and educate commercial colleagues      Ability and confidence to build and nurture relationships with external stakeholders like customers, clinicians and key experts.      A strategic mindset with an ability to balance operational work with long-term thinking      Excellent communication and presentation skills with executive presence      A talent scout with the ability to spot, hire, motivate, retain and build diverse teams      A strong desire to learn and continuously improve both in the technical aspects as well as the commercial aspects of the role.
column11: Product management, Automation, Hematology, Diagnostics, Market intelligence, Healthcare, Market research, Techno-commercial, Marketing strategy, Logistics

column2: GreyOrange is looking for a hands-on Product Manager who has exhibited exceptional and measurable product outcomes in domains related, but not limited, to supply chain, warehouse automation, warehouse management system and operations management.      Domains outside of these will also be considered but preference will be for the afore-mentioned domains.      We are looking for someone who is an excellent blend of analytical, mathematical, technical and product management skills.      Anyone who has demonstrated these through a blended experience as a developer or architect of software algorithms and as a product manager owning product vision and KPIs would be considered an excellent fit.          Technical skills involving familiarity or expertise into algorithms will be considered a great add-on     Product Management skills being sought for this role involve ability to drive product roadmap based on product gaps (functional and performance) identified through product usage data by oneself, customer feedback and industry research     A day in the life of product manager in this role will be analysing a lot of operational data and metrics and connecting with customers/users to identify opportunities of improvement which can range from deep algorithmic improvements to high precision process flows improvements to user interface improvements     The product manager will also be responsible for prioritising the identified areas of product enhancements for agile development teams and measuring the outcome of delivered capabilities     The product manager in this role should be willing to work as an individual contributor while owning a functional area within GreyMatterTM     This role will require product manager to identify product improvements, document those in the form of epics in JIRA and work with agile teams to get these prioritise         The person is expected to have understood the importance of oral and written communication and hence is expected to produce articulate write up of requirements     The person is also expected to guide the UX team to deliver excellent experience for the identified features

Experience in data-powered technologies such as catalog, product information management & insights preferred.             Knowledge of analytics tools such as Looker, Adobe analytics and experimentation platforms preferred.             Strong analytical skills, with the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex data sets.             Exceptional cross-functional collaboration skills and ability to influence without authority.

column2: This role will leverage his/her technical and strategic thinking capabilities and insights to roll-out and maintain    meaningful products in the fulfillment automation segment. This role allows the candidate to project entrepreneurship and leadership skills and contribute towards the success of the organization, through endeavors which may go beyond the expected KRAs            Key Responsibilities:          Technical direction of the project and product, anticipating requirements and actively mitigating high risk developments by working on multiple feasible solutions and delivering the most stable, secure and scalable product. column2: An extraordinarily talented group of individuals work together every day to drive TNS success, from both professional and personal perspectives.      Come join the excellence! The engineer will t Prepare, review and execute test plans for product Acceptance Testing.        Responsibilities            Job Title:    Customer Acceptance & Product Support Engineer            Position Summary:          Experienced Quality Assurance Engineer (Telecom Application Software) for providing Customer Acceptance and product Support.      Work closely with Engineering, Quality Assurance, Deployment teams to ensure highest level of Software quality and customer satisfaction.            Primary Duties and Responsibilities:            Analyze requirement and Functional specification and write required test specification      Prepare, review and execute test plans for product Acceptance Testing      Analyze test results, test metrics and present test reports for Telcom protocols (SIP, SS7, Diameter, MAP) & REST APIs      Provide product support for TNS CAS Platform and applications      Continuously provide inputs to improve software quality and product s robustness and availability      Work on complex problems and carry out exhaustive investigation/analysis along with necessary follow-up activities to identify the root cause and key out effective workarounds to resolve the field issues      Work closely with customer to understand the requirement & debugging of issues.            Qualifications:            7+ years of experience in product testing in distributed environment in Telcom domain      7+ years experience working on Linux/Unix systems (Red Hat, Ubuntu preferred)      Experience in driving and supporting User Acceptance Testing for telecom customers      Experience in Telecom Protocol Testing (SIP, SS7, Diameter, VOIP, VOLE, LTE) - MUST (Strong Experience in SS7, SIP, IMS)      Experience in handling functional automation testing using SPECTRA, Jmeter, SIPp, Valid8      Experience in product security testing; Exposure to vulnerability assessment tools RAPID7, Nessus      Experience in providing technical support to clients in order to help them troubleshoot issues      Working with clients to develop a test plan that meets their requirements      Experience in load testing and performance testing      Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities      Exposure to application servers, database and signaling protocols in telecom domain is mandatory      Team player with excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills            Optional Desired Qualifications            Red Hat, CentOS, Ansible, KVM, Docker, Kubernetes experience preferred      Experience with Oracle Database, SQL, shell scripting and networking concepts                Education and Certifications:            Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience required

column2: We re looking for a Senior Product Manager to help build the Tellius Analytics Platform as we scale it to the next phase. This is an individual contributor, hands-on role that requires strong technical acumen, deep analytics/business intelligence knowledge, and sharp product management skills along with a can-do attitude to build the best possible experience for our customers. Passion for Artificial Intelligence, Predictive Analytics, and Machine Learning technologies is a core requirement.           Your Impact       Manage products from inception to launch based on industry experience, market research, competitive analysis and feedback from customers and prospects.     Work with engineering, marketing, and sales to define product release requirements, help understand the competitive landscape, product positioning, target customer use cases and markets, and define the go-to-market strategy.     Develop product strategy and prioritize features.     Gather product requirements from customers and the internal field teams.     Write detailed and agile product requirements and ensure clear communication of those requirements to all stakeholders including management, engineering, design, and documentation teams.     Assist engineering teams in determining the best technical implementation methods.     Work very closely with development leads to plan, prioritize and track features and releases.     Collect customer feedback for product improvements.     Present product roadmap, released features and demos to customers, analysts, and internally to other groups.     Internal and external evangelism of the product through blogs, social media platforms, and industry conferences.           What you need       5 years of in-depth experience within the Analytics / Business intelligence (BI) domain with a strong understanding of the industry, market and competitive landscape.     3 years of experience in Product Management and/or, Sales Engineering roles with a complex B2B SaaS product.     Deep understanding of Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, SiSense, Looker, Zoomdata, Thoughtspot, OBIEE, Birst, GoodData, Cognos, Business Objects, DataRobot, H2O.ai, Dataiku, Trifacta, Alteryx or similar tools.     Experience across the product management lifecycle for enterprise SaaS products.     Strong UX and design thinking skills.     Data-driven approach to decision making.     Working knowledge of agile development methodologies.     Comfortable presenting in one-on-one customer settings as well in front of 100+ people.     Very strong written and oral communication skills and polished presentation skills.     Flexibility and willingness to step outside of traditional roles as needed in a fast-paced startup environment.     Team player with a can-do attitude.     Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics and/or related field.           Wouldn t hurt to bring along       Experience with AI, predictive analytics and machine learning landscape is a huge plus.     Working/Hands-on knowledge of SQL, Python, HTML, JavaScript, R, Spark, etc.     Master s in Computer Science and/or MBA degree.

column2: Research:    The Product Manager is responsible for constantly gathering information from clients, prospects, peers, stakeholders, and other BlackLiners. They will keep abreast of market research, competitive intelligence, accounting/finance news, and software trends. Research is conducted constantly, though a variety of channels, with an eye on both the specific product(s) that the PM is responsible for and broad, new ideas/concepts.       Roadmap:    Product Managers create, publish, and maintain both internal and external roadmaps. This means theyre responsible for balancing new-features, enhancements, design changes, and defect resolution while ensuring that their engineering team aligns to BlackLines business objectives.       Feature Design:    The entire process by which features move from idea to reality is owned by the Product Manager. PMs create Epics or PRDs, work with UX/UI designers to refine the interaction layout and interaction model, and consult with Tech Ops, Security, Legal and other internal stakeholders.       Product Development:    Product Managers are part of the engineering team tasked with delivering on the roadmap. This means that PMs will create stories, participate fully in grooming and sprint planning, and help ensure that the teams productivity, code quality, and output are acceptable. The Product Manager will also assist in managing the team by providing feedback, clearing blockers, and ensuring that all work proceeds apace.       Subject Matter Expertise:    By virtue of their close work with our clients and stakeholders, as well as their participation in the design process, Product Managers are expected to build a deep understanding of the product and market, as well as the fundamentals of accounting, design, and our technology. They will use that expertise in support of other teams, events, or clients.       Leadership:    Product Managers are expected to be willing and informed decision makers who drive projects to a successful completion, always have an opinion, and provide visionary leadership for their teams.       DUTIES       As Product Manager II, you own the full creation of the roadmap, make strategic decisions about the direction of your product, show good decision-making to balance delivery quality and development team happiness, keep development team informed about the long-term vision, and collaborate with UX.         Seeking a dynamic Product Manager to drive innovation in finance and accounting software. The ideal candidate will excel in translating CFO priorities into technical solutions,    optimizing journal entry workflows, enhancing general ledger functionality, managing subledgers, and streamlining accounts receivable and accounts payable processes. experience in reconciliation, netting, and settlement mechanisms is crucial.    Join our team to revolutionize financial technology for seamless, efficient, and precise financial management.             Minimum 2yrs experience with Finance and Accounting Software/Domain is a Must.           SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY       Receives only general guidance on the path forward for a given product     Is expected to set the product vision and pursue it with discretion     Receives limited supervision and is expected to produce a high volume of work and meet all deadlines without frequent oversight     Has broad responsibility for their product area and serves as the Product Owner for one or more teams.       SELECTED RESPONSIBILITIES       Provide product leadership to cross functional technical teams and implement process frameworks to drive project success     Foster a collaborative environment with other members of the organization to ensure the correct paths and details are established for projects     Communicate directly with clients and partners to determine project requirements and deliverables     Act as a mentor for incoming members of the Product Management team       What Youll Bring:            Years of Experience in Related Field:    3-4 years of product management experience with 5-6 years enterprise software involvement       Education: BA/BS in a technical/business field or a background in accounting/technology          Technical/Specialized Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:         Excellent written and verbal communication skills     Strong leadership skills with a willingness to make decisions     Comfort working in both a team environment and in a self-directed role     Excellent analytical and quantitative skills     Strong attention to detail and accuracy     Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously             Other:         Advanced customer knowledge, technical knowledge, teamwork, decision-making, strategic thinking, and leadership     Expert in terms of product scope, communication, independence, and details & quality       We re Even More Excited If You Have:            Understanding of accounting and finance concepts and terminology     Knowledge of modern web application architecture and engineering patterns and practices     Experience with Agile/Scrum     Familiarity market and organizational elements of both SaaS and Enterprise-scale Software

column2: You will impact the success of PayPal through the creation and launch of ServiceNow product features that meet stakeholders needs and help support PayPal s IT and business operations     Your work will enable PayPal to execute digital transformation and enablement functions with other key resources     As a subject matter expert, you will use process methodologies to serve as an internal coach to help others identify product enhancements               Your day to day        In your day to day role you will:         Coordinate the implementation and extension of PayPal s strategic planning lifecycle leveraging ServiceNow s Strategic Portfolio Management (SPM) applications.         Coordinate the migration and lifecycle of PayPal s capabilities, platforms, products, applications, and supporting services into ServiceNow Application Portfolio Management (APM) while leveraging the Common Service Data Model (CSDM) framework.         Create and maintain the backlog of ServiceNow development requests for SPM and APM using ServiceNow s Demand Management and Strategic Planning Workspace application.         Conduct application design sessions with SPM and APM stakeholders to ensure business requirements are met while protecting the platform from technical debt.         Bridge the gap among the different departments involved in successfully enabling your products, including business process owners, engineering, development, information security, and operations.                   What do you need to bring           Bachelor s degree OR appropriate combination of education and experience         7+ years experience in business analysis, product management, metrics and reporting, platform-based process management, or other relevant experience required         Hands-on experience enabling or operating ServiceNow SPM and APM         Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) - SPM         Experience working with ServiceNow as a planning tool and another software development tool such as Jira or Azure DevOps (ADO) for execution of development

column2: The Product Manager is responsible for both product planning and product marketing. It also includes working with sales, marketing, and support to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met. The Product Manager s job also includes ensuring that the product and marketing efforts support the company s overall strategy and goals.       What youll be responsible for?       Gather requirements from stakeholders and have them translated to product requirements.         Manage product backlog and product priorities of OTT channels: Rich business messaging/ RCS, WhatsApp, conversational platform.         Design, Implement, enable Integrations &deploy chat bot solutions on user stories around conversational flows for various channels (WhatsApp, RCS, Web etc]         Conduct competitor research to identify gaps in solutions and provide reports on timely basis.         Design functional aspects of customized projects/products and provide knowledge transfer to development team.         Monitor project status while in development, provide required assistance to developers and report to relevant stakeholders on the status of the project.         Collaborate with sales team on concalls and client site meetings to help them with technical solutions.         Constantly update the sales and presales team, customers about the products and services of Karix         Assess and analyse customer requirements and prepare required sales proposals.         Conduct and provide product demos for newly built features and functionalities.         Evaluate and respond to RFPs, RFIs and RFQs for platform requirements.         Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes.         Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact.         Collaborate with cross functional teams to drive product launches.         Ability to create internal product documents like concept notes, product specification documents, flow charts and manuals.         Requirement analysis & definition, business& systems analysis, solution design (Process modelling, Use cases, LogicalData Modelling, UML)           Qualification and other skills           Bachelor s Degree with min of 5-7 years of experience in working for CpaaS / CcaaS / SaaS filed. Preferred from SMS / Email/ Whatsapp / RCS business experience.       What youd have?       Knowledge on chatbots & automations         Prior experience of developing chatbots &automation         Strong Technical Background in mobility, telecom, or software development         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence various stakeholders.         Knowledge on REST API & JSON         Knowledge on WhatsApp business API, RCS &chatbot platform         Knowledge of MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, MSproject, MS Visio, Excel)         Knowledge on Figma         Strong at analytics, creativity, and quantitative skills         Fast learner and should be willing to wear multiple hats.         Takes ownership and accountability of the work.         Ability to work with ambiguity and solve problems through lateral thinking.         Excellent coordination skills to manage communication with various cross function teams.

column2: The ideal candidate is a self-starter, problem-solver and successful in combining technology and data into best-in-class outcomes     The candidate is energized by solving complex business problems and consistently effective in making high-judgement decisions at rapid pace amidst the frequent ambiguity that comes with charting a course of action with no precedent     Moreover, the ideal candidate is energized by an environment where strategy, innovation and decision-making are intentionally distributed, where candor, speed and data are highly valued and colleagues at all levels hold each other to unusually high standards on behalf of Quince customers       The Product Manager is responsible for delivering a differentiated product that addresses a business need and represents a viable business opportunity     A key component of this role is ensuring that the product supports the company's overall strategy and goals     The Product Manager is ultimately responsible for managing the product throughout its lifecycle - conception through end-of-life     As a Growth Product Manager, you will work alongside our team of world-class product managers, engineers, data scientists, and marketers to optimize two core metrics for Quince's efficient growth - retention acquisition       To be successful in this role, you'll have to tend to be skeptical, curious, and analytical           Roles responsibilities         Define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for our acquisition and retention optimization tech     Guide long-term thinking and innovation in an ambiguous and rapidly-changing space     Be the subject matter expert of various E-commerce Platform functions such as:     checkout and cart management, customer engagement experience to drive conversion payment and checkout gateway integration order fraud detection reviews, loyalty programs, offers, and discounts.      Pre-purchase and pre-fulfillment experience: creating a new order, considering inventory replenishment, canceling orders, pre-paid orders etc     Should be heavily data-driven, with extensive product-building experience in e-commerce     Work closely with the business and engineering teams to optimize the checkout experience to drive more conversions     Be the scrum master and the product owner (define stories and detailed specifications) in engineering sprints     Run beta and pilot programs with new products and features along with regular reviews with business teams to ensure that they meet the expectations         Goals          Own the product roadmap (3 months, 6 months, 1 year) for the Ecom Platform area     Build the reporting and insights for the checkout funnel, engagement experience, and promotion/offers     guide to the roadmap to continuously improve checkout conversion     Embed rigor around data quality and data-driven decision-making in the execution      Build low-touch processes, self-serve solutions, automation to eliminate the involvement of engineering in business-as-usual (BAU) activities - reduce engineering time spent in BAU activities to    Develop internal platform and operational dashboards to measure key metrics         Skills and Experience         Overall 12+ years of experience with at least 7 years in product management role for E-Commerce platform initiatives     Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority      Demonstrated success in defining and launching excellent products     Excellent written and verbal communication skills      Technical background     Passion to answer Product/Engineering questions with data     Capable of tackling very loosely defined problems     Experience in building e-commerce platform product

column2: As a Senior Product Manager at Ignosis, you will play a critical role in the lifecycle of our products, from strategy development to market launch      Your expertise will guide our products to meet evolving client needs and keep Ignosis at the forefront of industry innovation      Key Responsibilities        Product Strategy:    Formulate and execute a comprehensive product strategy, in line with our overarching goals and vision.        Roadmap Planning:    Lead cross-functional teams to prioritize and craft the product roadmap, aligning with both business objectives and customer requirements.        Market Research:    Conduct in-depth market research to identify trends, opportunities, and regulatory aspects in the FinTech sector.        Feature Definition:    Collaborate with stakeholders to define detailed product features and user experience requirements for the development team.        Agile Product Development:    Oversee the agile development process, ensuring a balance between rapid iterations and high-quality product delivery.        User Feedback:    Systematically gather and analyze user feedback to enhance product features and usability.        Competitive Analysis:    Perform continuous competitive analysis to maintain our innovative edge in the industry.        Collaboration:    Ensure effective collaboration among engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams for successful product launches and high customer satisfaction.      Qualification      Minimum 4 years of product management experience, preferably in the FinTech sector.      Understanding of India Stack and digital lending processes is advantageous.      Solid grasp of financial concepts, markets, and relevant industry regulations.      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-centric approach to decision-making.      Exceptional communication skills, capable of simplifying complex ideas for diverse audiences.      A customer-focused mindset, dedicated to creating user-centered products.      Innovative and strategic thinking abilities for ongoing product enhancement.      What s in it for you?      Develop products that directly impact the manner in which data/information is shared and used by a billion Indians.      Contribute directly to the next wave of growth for the FinTech industry in India by working closely on Digital Public Infrastructure like AA and OCEN-ONDC network (also touted as one of the next UPI moments of India)      High exposure to the Founders to understand how they think & solve the pressing issues of the clients with them.      Get to work with the largest banks, NBFCs and FinTech players in India and solve their pressing problems.      Last but not the least, an industry competitive compensation package    .

Excellent negotiation skills to resolve internal and external competing priorities.     Communicate effectively at all levels, from executive management to individual contributor. column2: As a Product Manager, this individual will work on initiatives spanning various aspects of Takeoff s solution suite, including inbound receiving, inventory management, automated and manual picking and packing, and manager visibility tools      This individual will develop a primary subject matter expertise in a subset of our product and use this SME to answer stakeholder inquiries, participate in product roadmapping exercises and advise other teams working on related features      This individual contributor is comfortable getting their hands dirty in the data and details to help drive initial value assessment, KPI definition, feature refinement and prioritization, value positioning, validation of business impact, and operational adoption      This individual is a critical problem solver with strong analytical skills who can translate product and engineering-driven projects into a value-driven backlog of executable work and able to effectively manage this backlog alongside competing priorities without impacting commitments      This individual is excited to collaborate with engineering counterparts to define work complexity, is able to clearly define deliverables and their business value, and effectively work with necessary individuals across the organization to ensure work is delivered quickly, with high transparency, and the right level of quality      This individual is a clear and proactive communicator, has excellent written and verbal communication skills, and is eager to partner with stakeholders to drive adoption of new features, gather qualitative and quantitative feedback to analyze their success, and incorporate this analysis into future considerations for their team to prioritise            This role is a hybrid of remote and in office but there is a general expectation to be in the Pune office with the development team a minimum of 3 days per week.        Some of the experience you will bring to the table:          BS Degree required; grocery, food service, or supply chain background preferred.          4+ years product management experience in an Agile environment.          Critical problem-solving skills to break down technical and business problems to an actionable list of prioritised work.          Demonstrated ability working with stakeholders to clarify business problems, identify improvement opportunities, and represent business interests during feature design and development.          Success in collaborating with engineering partners to define and deliver projects that leverage new technologies and reduce technical debt.          Comfortable working with data. Ability to extract, visualize, and communicate business insights from conducted data analysis.          Flexibility and adaptability. In a small startup environment, priorities and responsibilities change frequently. You ll need to learn new things quickly.          Demonstrated ability to manage a value-driven backlog against competing priorities.          Effective organization and time-management skills, excellent attention to detail, and self-motivation in a collaborative, fast-paced work environment.          Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills.          Preferred Skills:          B2B/operational product management experience.          Familiarity with Supply Chain Warehouse Automation practices.          Experience with Grocery industry.          Familiarity with Jira Confluence, Google BigQuery and Looker.          Ability to collaborate with and influence stakeholders from engineering to business both with and without direct responsibility.          Some of the reasons why people love working at Takeoff:          Were a successful, rapidly growing startup with an entrepreneurial vibe.          Were disrupting the eGrocery industry with our innovative business model.          Were passionate about what we do.          We get to be creative on a daily basis.          Youll work with a smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right, and is open to new ideas.          We believe in autonomy, and reward those who take initiative.          We offer competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits.

column2: The Product Owner (PO) role is a key leadership role within Emerson IT. If you are an experienced IT Analyst, Digital Business Systems interested in growing your career, this is an exciting opportunity for you! Based in any world area Emerson location, you will be responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing the Team Backlog to streamline the execution of program priorities with coordination and communication across multiple Agile Teams in an Agile Release Train (ART) within the Automation Solutions Platform Services. This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Management (PM), Customers, Business Owners, and other partners.         In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:         Work closely with the Product Management, architecture, and technical/delivery leadership to refine and prioritize the backlog of features and user stories.     Collaborate with the business partners on refining the scope of features.     Coordinate dependencies with other POs during each Program Increment (PI). This often occurs in PO/PM and ART Sync Events.     Consider business needs and feasibility aspects to prioritize the team backlog and avoid giving new requirements to the team during the iteration execution.     Define user stories and acceptance criteria, and drive backlog refinement events     Work closely with ART leadership on defining roadmap and delivery plans for multiple Epics.     Participate in Iteration Planning, Iteration Retrospective, and Daily Team Sync ceremonies.     Drive quality control of features by testing against Feature/User Story acceptance criteria, Definition of Done and non-functional requirements     Work closely with development team and QA team to detect quality issues and help to correct them.     Lead the effort in producing the System Demo for program and Value Stream partners.     Present accomplished PI Objectives for the team on the Inspect and Adapt Event.     Obtain feedback from Business partners and Customers on value of the delivered solutions continuously via interviews, meetings, iteration reviews and system demos. Share the feedback at ART level.     Collaborate with other team Product Owners in the Digital program on features that support the broader eCommerce solution.     Participate in Product Owner (PO) Community of Practice (CoP)     Document new functional features     Prepare and participate in Knowledge Transfer sessions among PO s.         Who You Are:       You are a servant leader who motivates team members to deliver to the success of the team goals. You consider the integration points of pieces and parts working together. You build and deliver solutions that meet customer expectations. You serve as a liaison between different partner groups. You adapt quickly to changing resource requirements and conditions. You celebrate successes with teams and inspect and adapt approaches regularly to continuously improve processes.         For This Role, You Will Need:         At least 5 years of relevant work experience in the IT software development field     IT Business Systems and e-Commerce Application scope and implementation     Data query language and reporting tools (Excel, Access, PL/SQL, Power BI, Microsoft Azure DevOps, MS Teams, MURAL, etc.)     Process and Scope Modelling     Knowledge of PO Roles & Responsibilities within a SAFe environment     Understanding of project management phases, techniques, and tools for a successful execution of Waterfall, Agile and/or hybrid methodologies. column2: You will be reporting directly to the Product Support manager and be providing in-depth technical support to our customers     You will be working closely with our development teams as part of supporting customers, gaining knowledge of our systems and increasing your technical skill set     We take our customers problems very seriously, and providing quick, friendly help to our users is a top priority throughout the company           Obtain the necessary knowledge and skills to ecome progressively proficient with our product, systems and supported languages and frameworks     Troubleshoot, perform in-depth investigations and solve technical support issues with external customers     Collaborate with fellow support colleagues and other internal organisations (eg development) to identify and propose solutions, achieving superior customer service     Identify fixes to bugs and define tasks for these to be implemented either by this support team or by other engineering teams      Develop tools and enhance documentation to improve our support processes     Look for ways to improve productivity of issue resolution and better ways to help our customers         We are looking for you if you have:         A personable, empathetic and professional manner when dealing with customers     Proficiency when reading, writing and speaking English     A systematic approach to problem solving and an eagerness to learn new skills and embrace new concepts and technologies     University degree (or equivalent) in a STEM subject where modules have involved programming     Demonstrable skill with at least one programming language     Bonus points for: relevant engineering experience eg industrial placement, final year project, side project, open source contributions.         Why you should join the SmartBear crew:         You can grow your career at every level.     We invest in your success as well as the spaces where our teams come together to work, collaborate, and have fun.     We love celebrating our SmartBears; we even encourage our crew to take their birthdays off.     We are guided by a People and Culture organization - an important distinction for us. We think about our team holistically - the whole person.     We celebrate our differences in experiences, viewpoints, and identities because we know it leads to better outcomes.         Did you know:         Our main goal at SmartBear is to make our technology-driven world a better place.     SmartBear is committed to ethical corporate practices and social responsibility, promoting good in all the communities we serve.     SmartBear is headquartered in Somerville, MA with offices across the world including Galway Ireland, Bath, UK, Wroclaw, Poland and Bangalore, India.     We ve won major industry(product and company) awards including B2B Innovators Award, Content Marketing Association, IntellyX Digital Innovator and BuiltIn Best Places to Work.
