column2: Work alongside our UX Design team; represent the customers voice during the ideation, validation, and iteration stages of product development     Work within a tripod structure to ideate concepts and drive them through incubation to commercialization.     Drive a lean and agile development process; define meaningful sprint cycles, and run constant data-driven experiments     Build and maintain a product roadmap that aligns with the team s mission and product strategy.      Define and own the measurable success metrics and Key Results for your initiatives; prioritize product development against those metrics     What Youll Bring to the Team      3+ years of work experience in product management and shipping successful products in the Enterprise space. Experience working in a high growth B2B SaaS environment is a nice to have.      Experience working with cloud APIs, and technical product integrations such as MS Office, CRM tools, etc.     Strong experience with agile product development; you can validate concepts and bring features to market quickly while iterating intelligently based on customer feedback     Sharp analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions     Demonstrates strong problem-solving abilities, and can comfortably navigate through ambiguity. Ability to pivot and adjust tactical strategies to meet evolving business needs.      Can effectively prioritize feature work alongside product health work that may include but is not limited to bug fixes, tech debt, and accessibility.     Curious, growth mindset: you humbly see critical feedback as a gift.     Where Youll Work      Loopio is based in Canada with hub regions around the world. Right now, our employees (or Loopers, as we call ourselves!) live and work in Toronto, Vancouver, London, and Gujarat.      Loopio is a remote-first workplace because we recognize the advantages of working flexibly. Our India hub employees live and work remotely within Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Bengaluru and work 11am - 7:30pm IST unless otherwise stated.      You ll collaborate with your teams virtually across India, UK and North America (we re just a Zoom call and Slack message away!) and have established core sync hours and focus time during the workday to enable us to work smarter together. Additionally, we encourage asynchronous collaboration to effectively work as a global #OneTeam!     Why Youll Love Working at Loopio      Your manager supports your development by providing ongoing feedback and regular 1-on-1s      You have tons of autonomy and responsibility: this role provides an opportunity to try new things and push creative boundaries     You ll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (every Looper receives a professional mastery allowance each year)     You ll be set up to work remotely with a MacBook laptop, a monthly phone and internet allowance, and a work-from-home budget to help get your home office all set up!      Join us in regular company socials, AMA (Ask-Me-Anything), and quarterly kick-off to celebrate the big wins and milestones as #oneteam!     You ll be joining a culture that has thoughtfully built out opportunities for connections in a remote first environment.     We have Employee Resource Groups, House Teams (curiousask us about it!), virtual yoga, cooking classes and many more moments for us to have fun and learn together!      You ll be a part of an award-winning workplace and one of Canada s fastest growing companies with ample opportunity to make a big impact here!

column2: As a Product Manager, you will play a crucial role in managing the product portfolio. You will be responsible for understanding market needs, defining product strategies, and overseeing the entire product lifecycle. Your primary focus will be on printers used in textile printing, catering to a diverse   client base in India and abroad.             Key Responsibilities:       Market Research:     Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape in the textile printing industry.   Analyze customer feedback, industry reports, and market dynamics to identify opportunities for product enhancement and innovation.     Product Strategy:     Develop a comprehensive product strategy aligned with the company s overall goals and objectives.   Define the product roadmap, including new product launches, feature enhancements, and product retirements.     Cross-functional Collaboration:     Collaborate with cross-functional teams including R&D, manufacturing, sales, and marketing to ensure seamless execution of the product strategy.   Work closely with engineers to translate customer requirements into technical specifications.     Go-to-Market Strategy:     Develop and implement effective go-to-market strategies for new product launches.   Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling product messaging, promotional materials, and sales tools.     Sales Enablement:     Provide sales teams with the necessary training and tools to effectively communicate product value propositions.   Work closely with the sales team to understand customer needs and market trends, adjusting product strategies accordingly.     Performance Analysis:     Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product performance and success.   Analyze sales data, customer feedback, and market trends to make data-driven decisions for continuous product improvement.     Customer Relationship Management:     Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers and partners.   Gather customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and to inform future product   development initiatives.       Qualifications:     Bachelor s degree in engineering with Masters in relevant field is a plus.   Proven experience in product management, preferably in the printing or textile industry.   Strong understanding of textile printing processes and technologies.   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.   Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.   Analytical mindset with a data-driven approach to decision-making

column2: This is a highly cross-functional role; youll work closely with Fulfil s merchants to uncover their business goals and then coach them on the best ways to use Fulfil to achieve them. Internally, you ll work closely across Fulfil s product, onboarding and success teams ensuring our merchants achieve maximum value. The product support team is the foundation of everything we do at Fulfil, and we take the role of supporting our merchants seriously. You ll be at the forefront of driving the quality service our merchants deserve; whether that be over email, over the phone, or via video conference. Were looking for someone who truly believes in the merchant experience and knows what it takes to drive performance at all levels.           What You ll Do:         Empathize with every aspect of the merchant experience, putting merchants needs first     Guide and coach merchants along with Fulfil s Customer Support team to ensure a delightful end user experience     Develop in depth product expertise as a master Fulfil user and teacher     Work closely with the onboarding and success teams to ensure a positive onboarding process for new merchants     Responsible for delivering on support KPIs such as Initial Response Time, Resolution Time, and Customer Satisfaction     Work with the Fulfil leadership team to manage and contribute to the effective rollout of new initiatives across Product and Customer Support     Partner closely with Fulfil s Engineering, Product, Technical Support, and Sales team to drive customer value     Take ownership over customer happiness and customer satisfaction - doing what it takes to help our merchants grow as a competitive differentiator in the ERP market     Write exceptional documentation that allows our merchants to learn on their own time and help themselves     Define best practices and streamline our customer support processes by designing and creating enablement curricula such as playbooks, presentations, videos, and other interactive course material     Coach merchants to be product experts and train their teams on Fulfil best practices so they become increasingly self-sufficient     Maintain high levels of customer engagement and satisfaction with a focus on customer dedication and loyalty             Requirements         Minimum 2 years relevant work experience in retail supply chain and/or warehouse operations experience     Previous experience in one or more of the following: Netsuite, SAP, JDA, or other WMS/ERP/Supply Chain Management software;     Previous experience in customer support or customer service role at a product company. column2: As a Product Manager at Jumbotail,  you will be the ambassador of our customers,  and address their needs and solve their problems by collaborating with our engineering and business teams. You will be fullstack hero from coming up with outstanding product vision and long term product strategy that is aligned with company vision and strategy,  to getting your hands dirty and work with engineers and business teams to deliver new products and features. You will be accountable for products and business metrics; you will relentlessly deliver world class customer experience through data backed decisions. You will envision products that help our business leaders their business goals and drive growth. You will be responsible for the product from inception to launch and iteration,  and will drive a cross- functional team to deliver innovative solutions to the market. You will own one or a number of our products on web,  mobile,  or platforms. Through your vision,  creativity,  and business skills,  you will open up new possibilities to our customers,  and partners. At all times,  you will be the guardian of customer experience and place customer first,  even when relentlessly driving business growth for business and operations.   Location:Bangalore  Skills   At least 2 years of consumer internet Product Management experience. Should have launched consumer internet products,  and managed it through entire product lifecycle concept,  prototype,  launch,  and iteration cycles.  Ideal candidates would have built products powered by big data/ algorithms.  Strong ability to do data driven product management (and even general) decision making. Ideal candidates would have hands on experience in data mining,  clickstream analysis,  and would have a good knowledge of statistical techniques.  Impeccable communication skills both spoken and written.  A good understanding of FMCG retail business is an advantage. However,  having strong sense of business and retail,  is sufficient.  Demonstrated ability to interface with management (Founders) and business leaders across the startup,  drive vision,  strategy,  and influence decisions.  Ideal candidates would be an all stack leader that can juggle driving prioritization conversations and business strategy meetings with founders,  and cross functional business stakeholders,  and at the same time,  be able to debate on efficient algorithms with data scientists,  do a design review with designers,  or dive deep into technical discussions with engineering teams about how their current tech choices and approach could impact future business requirements.  No BS please. Strong courage of conviction displayed with Humility and Empathy. Fire in the belly to build world changing products.  MBA from ISB,  IIM- A, B, C,  or Top 5 institutes. Bachelors in CS,  EE.If candidates dont have MBA,  then Bachelors from CS/ EE from IIT with a background in software engineering in consumer internet products,  mandatory.  If you  have a technology mindset with strong skills in CS fundamentals,  data and analytics  love solving real world problems using data and technology  love design and have a natural inclination in solving problems with better design  Build and lead great teams  can apply first principles thinking to solve problems  can envision a great future that you want create  have the fire in your belly to get out of your cube and do something about your vision and passion  work with some really smart people,  and still raise the bar for all of us  can have fun and help your colleagues have fun doing all of the above..  we would like to hear from you..

column2: Can you be a leader to help drive strategy and execution for real-time payments solutions around the worldTo do so, you will have a deep knowledge of payments and how banks offer services to their customers     You will understand ISO20022-based real-time payments switches, supporting domestic instant payments, digital overlay services and use cases that drive growth     You will have a strong operational background, able to create PL financial reports relevant to the business line, manage partnerships with large global customers, and be able to program manage new initiatives              Job Responsibilities:          One of a team of leaders to provide go-to-market guidance and assets to sales executives for account-to-account payments globally, reporting directly to ACI s Head of Real-Time Payments.      Work across ACI s global customer base, our partners and ACI s regional commercial and delivery teams. column2: We are looking for an experienced    Associate Product Manager - User Research    to join our global product team.      You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to research, design, build, and roll out customer- and internal-facing products that deliver the company s vision and strategy.        This role reports to the Head of Product.        Key responsibilities:            Research Design:    Design and conduct qualitative and quantitative research studies to understand customer behaviors, needs, and motivations. This includes online surveys, customer interviews, and monitoring of various internal feedback sources.        Data Analysis:    Analyze research and other data to identify patterns and insights that can inform product decisions and improvements.        Collaboration:    Work closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to integrate research findings into the product development process.        User Testing:    Conduct usability testing sessions to evaluate product prototypes and existing features for effectiveness and user satisfaction.        Reporting:    Present research findings and actionable recommendations to stakeholders to drive evidence-based decision-making.        Documentation:    Develop and maintain research documentation, including participant recruitment criteria, research questions, study guides, and findings reports.        Strategic Influence:    Influence product strategy and roadmap decisions by providing user-centered insights and advocating for user needs. Facilitate workshops and brainstorming sessions based on research findings to drive design and product innovation.        Market Research:    Conduct market research as needed to supplement user research and provide a comprehensive view of the market landscape.          Minimum of 3 years of experience in user research or a similar role within a tech company.      Strong grasp of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including expertise in customer interviews, surveys, usability testing, and data analysis using modern analytics tools as well as SQL.      Excellent analytical skills with an ability to distill complex data into clear, actionable insights.      Strong communication skills, with proficiency in presenting research findings to diverse audiences.      A proactive, independent work style, capable of taking initiative in a fast-paced environment.

column2: Greetings !! Fairgrowth, a trusted executive search firm in Mumbai since 1998, has partnered with a leading manufacturer of innovative mobile phone accessories and gadgets. Position: Product Manager We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the end-to-end product life cycle, from conceptualization to launch and beyond. This role requires a strong blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and drive product success.   Responsibilities:   Product Strategy:  Develop and articulate a clear product vision and strategy aligned with company goals and market demands. Conduct market research, analyze industry trends, and gather customer feedback to inform product decisions.   Roadmap Planning : Create and maintain a comprehensive product roadmap that prioritizes features and enhancements based on business objectives, user needs, and technical feasibility. Continuously refine the roadmap to adapt to changing market dynamics and emerging opportunities. Requirement Gathering : Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams, to gather and prioritize product requirements. Define user stories, acceptance criteria, and success metrics to guide product development efforts.   Product Development : Lead the product development process from concept to launch, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality features and releases. Work closely with engineering teams to define technical specifications, resolve implementation challenges, and maintain alignment with project timelines.   User Experience : Champion a user-centric approach to product design and development, focusing on delivering intuitive and seamless user experiences. Conduct usability testing, gather user feedback, and iterate on product designs to optimize usability and satisfaction.   Cross-Functional Collaboration:  Foster strong partnerships across various departments to drive alignment and collaboration throughout the product life cycle. Communicate product updates, milestones, and challenges to stakeholders, soliciting input and addressing concerns proactively.   Market Launch:  Develop go-to-market strategies and collaborate with marketing and sales teams to execute product launches effectively. Prepare product documentation, marketing collateral, and training materials to support sales enablement and customer adoption.   Product Evangelism:  Serve as a passionate advocate for the product both internally and externally. Actively engage with customers, industry influencers, and other stakeholders to evangelize the product value proposition and gather insights for future enhancements.   Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred. Proven experience7 years in product management roles, with a focus on end-to-end product life cycle management. Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking abilities, with a track record of translating complex business requirements into actionable product plans. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels. Technical proficiency and understanding of product development processes, methodologies, and technologies. Demonstrated success in bringing innovative products to market and driving adoption and growth. Passion for technology, user experience, and solving customer problems. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to evolving priorities and challenges.
column11: Manufacturing Processes, Electronics, Product Life Cycle, Product Strategy, Requirement Gathering, Product Roadmap

column2: We are looking for a Product Manager for the Onboarding & HR experience pod. The HR experience pod is responsible for all things insurance & healthcare management for employees. Our SaaS offering is used by thousands of HR s and admins bringing ease of administration with a world-class product standard.             ?       Responsibilities:         Partner with customers and business stakeholders to understand explicit and latent needs      Partner very closely with High Performing Engineering teams to ensure we are building scalable software products that meet customer needs and are on time with quality.     Prioritize product features, author and review Product Requirement Documents (PRDs)     Run user research, usability studies, data-driven experiments to inform product direction     Establish, monitor, and measure success metrics after launch. Consistently integrate behavior data and customer feedback into key product decisions.     Make the thousands of unsexy decisions, and shoulder the dirty work reviewing insurance contracts, copy, support issues, etc that helps your team charge forward without stall           Experience & Qualifications         At least 3 years of relevant experience as a Product Manager, preferably in SaaS or growth-facing products.     You have Strong analytical skills, testing product hypotheses and generating insights.     You understand what comprises a world-class user experience and how to bring together technology and design thinking to accomplish it.     Good experience with Information Architecture, UX, Wireframes, UI, Interaction Design, prior development experience, or a relevant degree in tech would be a huge plus.     You have the ability to take larger goals, opportunities, and needs and break them down into iterative, actionable milestones to create features and products in order to get to a product-market fit         How you'll know you are successful         % of outstanding customer problems that are either validated or invalidated (should be low, because you know the ins and outs)     Decrease in the number of unexpected requests to the product team coming in during the quarter (because you were way ahead of them!)     The commercial success of the product on the market.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Product Manager to join our team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in defining and executing product strategies, managing the product lifecycle, and driving product development initiatives. This role offers the opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact products and solutions.                Key Responsibilities:              Defining product vision, strategy, and roadmap based on market trends, customer needs, and business objectives.          Gathering and prioritizing product requirements from stakeholders, customers, and market research to inform product development priorities.          Collaborating with engineering, design, marketing, and other cross-functional teams to define product features, specifications, and user experience.          Leading the product development process from concept to launch, including product planning, development, testing, and release.          Monitoring and analyzing product performance metrics, user feedback, and market trends to identify opportunities for improvement and innovation.          Managing product launches, marketing campaigns, and go-to-market strategies to drive adoption and revenue growth.          Serving as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries, feedback, and escalations from internal and external stakeholders.              Qualifications:              Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field; Master s degree or MBA preferred.          Proven experience in product management, with a track record of successfully launching and managing products from concept to market.          Strong understanding of product management principles, methodologies, and best practices.          Excellent project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.          Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.          Experience working in Agile development environments and using Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) is a plus.          Experience working on multidisciplinary projects and interfacing with clients is a plus.

column2: You will be a key member of the Digital Product Management team that is responsible for conceptualizing, designing, and delivering the online customer experience and marketing data innovations that drive Williams-Sonoma Inc.s industry leading digital business. you'll be working with amazing peers, cutting edge technologies and deep resources to help push the boundaries of digital innovation.         ?       Responsibilities include:          Develop business requirements and detailed JIRA user stories related to analytics and tracking of website features and functionality.      Work as part of the analytics and tagging scrum team, and participate in Agile activities and meetings (standups, grooming, planning)      Augment, support, and troubleshoot feeds to and from Adobe Analytics platform. Work closely with cross-functional partners on feed configuration requirements and deployment needs.      Support administration of the Adobe Analytics toolset, including variable allocation and configuration, data classifications, and user administration.      Assist with post-release validations and auditing of tags and reports for stability. Create and run validation dashboards for critical releases.      Configure and monitor alerts for breakage. Triage, research, and document tracking bugs in JIRA and Confluence as needed.     Support QA automation initiatives and build related roadmap to expand automation coverage.      Consult with product management, marketing, product analytics, and business teams on analytics and tagging, as needed      Assist with initiatives related to improving the analytics foundation and related toolsets.      Coordinate with marketing stakeholders and vendors on requirements clarifications and deployment of vendor pixels.      Join vendor calls and coordinate support and troubleshooting related to analytics toolsets.      Document tracking initiatives and tagging behavior in Confluence to facilitate understanding and usage by cross-functional teams.      Support ad hoc questions from analytics and reporting stakeholders regarding performance reporting, variable logic, or tagging coverage.      Performs other duties as required. We think you should be excited about this opportunity because you will:      Work on initiatives of incredible opportunity and scale      Be right in the middle of the action. E-Commerce & Marketing is at the core of WSIs growth (>50% of company sales) and will continue to be a competitive advantage that fuels our success.      Establish ownership of a critical domain and collaborate with every level of the organization      Be hands on with current web analytics tools from the leaders in the space      Directly see how your leadership ability, ideas and efforts positively impact the online experience of our customers and growth of our business.      Work in a truly process and data-driven environment. We practice what we preach.      Work at the pace and excitement of a start-up with the resources of a $5 billion company.      Be treated like an entrepreneur and expected to bring innovative ideas to the table and execute them to completion.      Work with a world-class product team with a history of success and reputation for excellence.      We work with great brands and solve interesting problems with technology.         Qualifications:          3+ years of Product Management experience in technology organizations.      3+ years of experience with Adobe Experience Cloud/Platform toolset, (Target, Analytics, CJA, AEP, RTCDP) including working on tracking requirements and coordinating tagging implementation.      Experience with instrumentation of marketing and vendor 3rd party pixels      Experience with analytics design and data capture strategies for iOS native applications      Advanced knowledge in web analytics data fundamentals and website measurement strategy.      Experience with Agile methodologies, and with JIRA and Confluence toolsets.      Experience with or exposure to a tag management system and digital data layer as foundational pieces to an analytics program.      Ideally you have experience in multi-channel retail or e-commerce (not a must).      You have impeccable communication skills with diverse audiences.      Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up recommendations and drive actions.      Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, familiarity with services model solutions, manage trade-offs and evaluate new ideas with stakeholders      You have a point-of-view on how technology teams should engage to iteratively and efficiently deliver value for the customer (ideally with Agile methodologies).      You care about the quality of your work and that is evident in all that you do.      Strong drive towards execution; can-do type of person and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job done.      Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with various teams across the organization.      You have a Bachelors degree or more in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. An equivalent combination of related education, training and experience will be considered -- we care more about your work experience than what you did in college.

Job Profile        New Product engineering development with the world s best quality ensuring seamless flow to the bulk production stage.   Creating a Product Design Library having a universe of designs covering wider range of categories and capabilities ready for offer to merchandizing based on market trends.   Ensuring consistent flow of designs for development exploiting the core strength of manufacturing like gold studded, solitaires etc..   Bring in trends and techniques from international space through mount route by continuously exploring various sources fairs across globe.   Possess strong network in the field of Jewellery manufacturing retail extracting the market happenings , trends advancements    Establishing high value development capability at Inhouse manufacturing understanding the market need and customer preferences.   Creating an ecosystem of Jewellery manufacturing at the source of emerging trends techniques in the form of development centers across globe.    Explore Adapt quickly to the technological advancements in the field of Jewellery manufacturing and transferring that as a saleable point for the brand.       Key Deliverables        New Product development Capability enhancement to the world s best level.   High Value capability development and establishment maximizing high value share.   100% CAD only at Inhouse manufacturing with expert designers from across globe.   Exclusive Tanishq international range of products generating 500 Crs value.   1000 Crs international mounts every year consistently generating value.   100% TDS development and manufacturing only at Inhouse.   Designs Hit rate 85% plus consistently in every collection core developments.       The right Person        Graduate or Diploma (In Engineering Jewellery) , Any Degree   Minimum 20 years of experience in Jewellery manufacturing with end to end knowledge over Jewellery manufacturing right from Design , CAD stage .   Exhibiting Hands on Skills technical knowledge especially in design interpretation , manual sketching , CAD CAM , master making is preferable    Ability to apply Design thinking approach in new product development.   Exposure to International Jewellery Manufacturing techniques and product range.   Work experience in international Jewellery manufacturing companies is Preferable.

column2: 1.Need 10+ years of experience.   2.Need Product Owner in technical and functional role and be able to assist Engineering Technical Lead   3.He/ she must be well versed about the SDLC of SaaS products from the scratch like planning, designing, developing and implementation and providing 3rd or 4th line of support .   4.Candidate should exhibit core skills like Overall technical Architecture framework at an enterprise level, He needs to represent the solution to Design Authority board. Even though the solution is inherited by the Vendor, Vendor Liaison will not be able to represent it the board. It s the candidate should accumulate all required information before presenting it.   5.Candidate should be able distinguish between various services involved in the solution and able depict the current scenario-based solution which should be in lined with the approved Amadeus framework approach currently which are adopted within the industry (Travel Domain knowledge is add On)   6.Good knowledge on the End user service is a must. It might be infra collaboration (DC services ,Network and Cloud services) Mobility (Like MDM),Integration and automation and Data services(Data Visualization, Analytics, Data storage , integration, and management)   7.Fair knowledge on Business applications like plan services, Build services, sell services etc.   8.Must have IT Governance and security knowledge.   9.With specifically with regards to security , he/she should have an experience in defining the roadmap of full cybersecurity risk assessment (its to implement a SIEM )Solution , For example : Details Threat modelling, Data flows, Threat detections and prevention mechanisms,   10.Understanding of Penetration test result and rectifying it   11.Also need to know what tools are used to find the vulnerability and its scan result , How to address it. At least able to give a thought to Risk and compliance. To fix it with technical team   12.Lead the Entire Office and strategy and services as Engineering Technical Lead.   13.Thought to leadership and defining on roadmap, strategy, and planning to the Board.   14.Well versed with Agile methodologies , Act as Technical Product Owner cum Solution owner   15.Good to have a process knowledge, working with Vendor and 3rd party solution provider.   16.As product Owner , he/she should have knowledge on Business analysis like Go to market, exploration, case study, validation, assessment.    17.Also should be able to provide information in defining success criteria, QBR ( assist the leaders with data for presentation), some time need to present too in the absence of the responsible person.       Generic roles asks are below.       18.Collaborated with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements and propose effective solutions.   19.Conducted feasibility studies and provided critical insights for strategic decision-making on various level like Solution overview document and product specification with functional details.   20.Developed and maintained documentation, including solution overviews, interface control documents, and product specifications.         Skills:       Analytical Thinking     Leadership     Product Owner      Product Management
